loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en: Sina’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sina makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker and tailor at factory to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a vendor selling vegetables, eggs, and bananas.. She is 39 years old, married and has three children. She uses her income in education fees, meals and other bills at home. Through her small business, she sustains her family’s needs. 

Julie wants to increase her profits so she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy trays of eggs, tomatoes, and eggplant to sell. 

She will invest the additional profits for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy trays of eggs, tomatoes, and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma is 38-year-old lady living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a motor rickshaw for several years, but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. Therefore, Asma has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner, so her husband will be able to buy a new body for his motor rickshaw. 

She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings until the time comes for her children to marry in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new body for her husband's motor rickshaw

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William  de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, tuvo el apoyo de personas vecinas que le ayudaron a cambio de trabajos que asía por las tardes en la limpia de un vivero de jardín, para conseguir dinero y poder asistir a la escuela.

Hoy en día está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a trabajar como cosmetóloga en su casa, y son padres de una niña de un año de edad.  

William por su parte realiza trabajos de albañilería en proyectos de las alcaldías y particulares; pero no es permanente por lo que necesita avanzar hacia otro trabajo donde obtenga ingresos diarios, él se dedica a este trabajo porque era lo que su papá le enseño.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para remodelar un local, para que su esposa pueda tener su sala de belleza bien ubicada y con lo necesario.
  
El sueño más grande de William es que su esposa en el futuro logre establecer un local muy apetecido por sus clientes, y así poder sacar adelante a su hija que ya luego empezara a asistir a la escuela y su sueño es que sea una profesional.
texts.en:
William, 32 years old, studied to high school. He had the support of neighboring people who helped him change jobs, spending the evenings cleaning a garden nursery to earn money and be able to attend school.

Now, he's married and his wife earns a living as a beautician in their house. They are parents of a one-year-old girl.

William, meanwhile, does masonry work on municipal and individual projects, but it is not permanent, because he needs to move to another job where he gets a daily income. He does this work because it's what his father taught him.

The loan he's seeking from Credicampo is to remodel a room so his wife can have her beauty salon well-located and with what she needs.

William's biggest dream is that his wife succeeds in establishing a very desired location for local customers, and thus they can raise their daughter who will later begin school. His dream is that she become a professional.

loans.use: to remodel a room so that his wife can have her beauty room well-located and with what's necessary.

loans.name: Yai's Group

texts.en: Yai’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yai makes a living cultivating rice and raising the pigs with her family and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family and ave money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 50 year old, married, woman living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a butcher shop; he earns insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy beef from the market and sell it from his butcher shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which reduced his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. Because of this, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that they can buy a bull calf for producing beef. 

Parveen wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams of providing all the facilities of life to her children. 

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf for producing beef.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Ruqia's husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore for many years, but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully damaged. He has sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer for a very low price, and now wants to buy a new auto rickshaw, but is still short of the full amount.

Ruqia's husband is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without a rickshaw. Ruqia has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw. Ruqia and her husband thank Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is aged 34 and married with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Geofrey is a cheerful, honest and hardworking man who owns a stationery shop. He earns a salary as additional income. He has been in that business for four years. He has a dream of serving the community with good and quality stationary, which enables him to get high profits and look after his family. Geofrey needs a loan to buy stationery to sell.

loans.use: to buy stationery to sell.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is 49, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family, and she is the mother of three sons and two daughters. To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. Jameela and both of her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her elder daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work with her, and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Jameela wants to buy a new juki machine for her elder daughter, so that she can contribute with her income by sewing clothes.

Therefore, Jameela has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy a new juki machine for her daughter. She wants to make some savings so that she can arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughters. Jameela thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new juki sewing machine for her daughters' tailoring business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
From the town of Dulag in Leyte, Arlene is a 33-year-old mother of three children ages one, six, and 12. She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business for four years now, and is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise and fresh fish to sell. 

Arlene is confident that she can make her business more successful someday with all her hard work and perseverance. In the future, she hopes to continue sending her children to school and to venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to buy piglets and fresh fish

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 46 años de edad,  estudio hasta cuarto grado, la escases de recursos económicos en su hogar, la falta de motivación por parte de sus padres, le estanco el camino de seguir preparándose, se casó a la edad de los 22 años, han tenido tres hijos con su esposo, quien por hoy se encuentra trabajando en el exterior para darle una mejor vida a su familia, sus dos hijos menores asisten a la escuela.

Ella es ama de casa, trabajo que ha realizado desde tiempos de su infancia, siendo sus padres los encargados de enseñarles todo lo relacionado al trabajo, anteriormente trabajo 10 años en un comedor de cocinera, luego el calor del fuego le hacía mal en la piel dejo de trabajar, por hoy solo se dedica a los trabajos y al cuidado de sus hijos. Empieza su rutina de trabajo a las 6:00 am a preparar a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela, terminando a las 7:00 pm dándole cena para posteriormente ir a la cama.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar cemento, arena, graba y el pago de la mano de obra, para el mejoramiento del piso de la casa donde vive.

Espera seguirse dedicando a sus hijos y su cuidado, espera que sus hijos se preparen en los estudios, que puedan ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old and studied up to Grade 4. Due to a lack of resources in her household and the lack of motivation on the part of her parents she was held back from continuing her studies. She married at 22 years of age and has three children with her husband. He is abroad working to provide a better life for his family. The two youngest children attend school. She is a housewife, work she has done since she was an infant. Her parents took it upon themselves to teach her everything about this work. 

She worked in a cafe for 10 years but later on the heat from the stoves hurt her skin so she left this work. Today she only works taking care of her children and doing the housework. She starts her work routine at 6 am preparing the children to go to school, finishing at 7 pm having given them dinner before they go to bed. 

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy cement, sand, gravel and to pay for labor to make improvements of the floor of the house she lives in. She hopes to continue to dedicate herself to her children. She hopes that they continue to prepare themselves with their studies so that one day they are someone in life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Марии всего 31. Она с супругом и ребенком живет в Стебнике. Работает она в торговом центре г.Дрогобыч женской обувью и одеждой. Помещение для ведения бизнеса арендует. Мария — очень приветливая, культурная, открытая, что помогает привлечь достаточно клиентов и заработать постоянных в том числе. 
Марии нужна сумма в 40 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить женскую осенне-зимнюю обувь и одежду. Со временем Мария планирует расширить бизнес, открыть еще одну торговую точку.
texts.en:
Mariya is 31 and lives with her husband and child in Stebnik. She sells women's clothing and shoes at the shopping centre in the city of Drogobych, renting a space for her business. She is friendly, cultured and open, which helps her attract enough clients and earn repeat customers.

Mariya needs 40,000 griven to purchase women's clothing and footwear for the fall and winter season. In time she plans to expand her business and open a second retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy footwear and clothing for the fall and winter season

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for her junkshop business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her mini-canteen and by selling cosmetic products.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 30,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, Vilma wants to have a bigger store. She dreams for her children to finish their studies and fulfill their life goals. Each week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. There, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 58 years old, married, and had four children. She manages a store for income. She revolved her income in her retail store and the other part is spent on daily expenses of the family, like daily meals. She wanted to increase her profits but had insufficient funds, which is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, and vinegar. Selling more items would give her additional profits in return.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to  sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, and vinegar

loans.name: Hamadah

texts.en:
Hamadah is a 28-year-old single man from Rafah city. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Hamadah is a student, where he studies business administration. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future so he can help his family to improve their living conditions. 

Hamadah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Hamadah will be able to write his research and seminar easily. 

Hamadah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his study.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 46 years old, married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has sold crude salt for the last 20 years. Agnes has a dream of educating her children for a brighter future and becoming rich. Agnes is a hard-working woman asking for support to enable her grow her business. However she is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Agnes wants money to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en: Sem is 42 years old, married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Sem owns a textile shop majoring in women clothes. He earns an additional income from farming. He has been in that business for 10 years. Sem has a dream of expanding his business. Sem is a hardworking man despite the challenge of limited capital. He needs a loan to buy more dresses, shirts, suits and blouses for selling.

loans.use: to buy more dresses, shirts, suits, and blouses for selling.

loans.name: Bakereti

texts.en:
Bakereti, a 47-year-old mother of seven children, lives in Kasese, Uganda where she operates a cosmetics shop, a business she started to support herself. She has requested a loan to buy more cosmetics to sell

Bakereti dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is 47 years old and married with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is in goat rearing and selling. He has been in that business for fifteen years and gets additional income from farming along with a salary from teaching. Josephat began the business to earn a living and support his family. Josephat has a dream of educating his children. He is a hardworking man, though challenged with limited capital. Josephat needs money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 44-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses in nearby towns for many years. He has been recruiting skilled persons to do embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some material home for Yasmeen because she helps him in embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts. 

He wants to meet the demand of bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. He requires some capital to buy the desired inventories but does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Yasmeen humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, her husband will be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

Yasmeen is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Shena

texts.en: Shena is a 22 year old college undergraduate who lives in Bago City.  She is married to Aldrin, a laborer in a sugarcane plantation.  They have one 2 1/2 year old child.  Their total monthly family income is only Php 4000 ($91).  Shena has long seen the need to help her spouse but didn’t have the means until she learned about the 2 months training program of Bagosphere’s. She needs your help to finance her tuition.  Once Shena starts earning, she can help provide her family’s basic needs and then save some money for her child’s education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Jessa Mae

texts.en: Jessa Mae is an 18-year old high school graduate who lives in a rural area in Bago City.  She belongs to a family of 5.  Her father works as community employee and her mother is a housewife.  Jessa Mae has 2 siblings.  Her eldest brother is in high school and her younger sister is in elementary.  Their total monthly family income of Php 3000 ($68) is not even enough to provide for their basic needs.  This motivates Jessa Mae to find means to help the family have more income that’s why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job.  Apart from helping her family, Jessa Mae also dreams to become a successful person someday and to have a sustainable income.  Your generosity in funding her loan will help Jessa Mae achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Ginaly

texts.en: Ginaly is a 27-year old graduate of a vocational course.  She lives in a rural area in Bago City.  She belongs to a family of 5.  Her father is a farmer and her mother has a mini-convenience store.   Ginaly has 2 siblings.  Her younger brother is a construction worker and her younger sister has her own family in Manila. Their total monthly family income of Php 7000 ($159) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Ginaly to find means to help the family have more income that’s why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job.  Apart from helping her family, Ginaly also dreams to build her own house and also to give more capital to her mother’s mini-convenience store.  Your generosity in funding her loan will help Ginaly have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
María, se dedica a vender tortillas y hamacas, está acompañada, con su compañero de vida tienen tres hijos, de los cuales solo uno depende de ellos; con esfuerzos  se ha mantenido trabajando en su negocio para salir adelante con su familia, elabora la venta de tortillas todos los días,  de 10:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., las vende en una galera fuera de su vivienda y su hija sale a venderlas de manera ambulante en la zona donde vive, las hamacas los hace de manera esporádica en el tiempo libre con apoyo de su esposo que luego salen a venderlas.
El préstamo le será de utilidad para invertir en mejorar la infraestructura de  la galera en la que ubica su negocio, le permitirá protegerse del sol o la lluvia, así también podrá evitar contratiempos para mantener su negocio funcionando, espera mejorar la competitividad de su negocio y mantenerse generando ingresos.
María sueña con poyar a su hijo a que se gradúe de la universidad y seguir trabajando para cubrir sus compromisos.
texts.en:
María works selling tortillas and hammocks. She is in a relationship and has three children with her life companion. Only one of them is dependent on her. With effort she has continues working in her business to raise her family. She makes tortillas every day from 10 am until 5 pm. She sells them in a stand outside her house and her daughter goes out and sells them in the streets in the area in which they live. She makes the hammocks in a informal manner when she has spare time and with the help of her husband who goes out to sell them. 

The loan will be used to invest in making improvements on the infrastructure of the stand where her business is located. It allows her protection from the sun and the rain. She can also avoid setbacks to keep her business operating. She hopes to improve the competitiveness of her business and continue to generate income. 

María dreams of supporting her son so that he graduates from university and continue to work in order to fulfill her obligations.

loans.use: to invest in making improvements to the infrastructure of the stand where her business is located.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 44-year-old woman from the community of Dulag, Leyte. For 22 years now, she has been fishing and selling fish for a living. Her business helps in raising her four children aged 10-21. She is asking for a loan to buy fresh fish and fishing nets to further expand her business. Edna is optimistic that she can make her business more successful and live in abundance in her old age.

In the future, Edna hope that she can give her children a good life by sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and fishing nets

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 54-year-old married woman living with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore. She is a wholesaler of rice; she buys the rice from harvesters at a low price and sells from her house in Lahore city to the retailers. She buys rice of various kinds such as basmati, super kernel, etc. She has been doing this same practice for many years and has many reputable retailers who like to buy rice from her in large quantities. In this tenure she has built up positive relationships with the retailers, and her customers have become a source of advertisement for her. 

With the increase in new customers, Parveen wants to buy rice in larger quantities so she can easily cope with the rapid rise in demand. In this way she will be able to increase her monthly income and savings as well. Parveen praises this honorable support; she thanks Kiva and Field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 43-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.

Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy gentlemen's shoes for his shoe store. He has been selling ladies' fancy and casual shoes in his hometown for many years. Most of his customers demand gents' shoes as well, but due to lack of funds, he cannot purchase them. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan so her husband can buy a variety of gents' shoes for his store. In this way, he can easily cope with the demand and avoid his customers' disappointment.

His shop is situated in the shoe market and a lot of other shoe stores are there, which becomes the source of tough competition. He dreams of moving his shop to another place to avoid his competitors. Through the investment of this current loan, he can easily establish his shoe store and can enhance his savings so his dream can come true.

Shazia thanks Kiva, honorable lenders, and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a variety of gents' shoes for her husband's shoe store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 19 years old, a high school graduate, and lives in Bacolod city. She belongs to a family of 6. Her father is unemployed, and her mother cooks food in a small eatery. Irene has 3 siblings in high school and in elementary school. 
Irene worked as a baby sitter for one year.  She earned Php 1500 ($34) per month, but this income was not even enough for her personal needs.  Irene would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at Bagosphere might make her realize this goal.  
Irene aims to finish her training and help her family provide their basic needs.  Her biggest dream in life is to become a successful policewoman. Your generosity in funding her loan would greatly motivate Irene to achieve her goal for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es:
Saúl, está acompañado, tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, toda la familia vive junta, no tiene remesas del extranjero; como una forma de tener recursos económicos para dar a su familia lo más básico, hace mucho tiempo con esfuerzos logro hacer la apertura de una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, en la cual trabaja todos los días de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, es apoyado por su familia para atender el negocio.
Necesita el capital para comprar vitrinas nuevas de aluminio y vidrio, le permitirá mejorar la visibilidad de sus productos y aumentar el inventario, además de esta manera atraerá nuevos clientes y cubrirá las nuevas demandas que estos hagan.
Sus proyectos son mantener con vida su fuente de ingresos para ir cambiando el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Saúl is in a relationship and has a 12 year old son. All his family lives together and they do not receive money from the exterior. As a way of having economic resources to provide the most basic things for his family he opened a store selling basic food items a long time ago. He works there every day from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. He is helped by his family taking care of the store. 

He needs the capital to buy new aluminum and glass display cases. This will allow him to improve the visibility of his products and increase his inventory. Also in this manner he can attract new clients and comply with the new demands they will have. His goals are to keep his source of income alive, to change his family's style of living.

loans.use: to buy new aluminum and glass display cases for his products.

loans.name: Fialupe

texts.en: Fialupe is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. Fialupe needs a loan to buy canned items, frozen goods, cooking oil, mosquito coils, a new freezer and a new hanging scale. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy canned items, frozen goods, cooking oil, mosquito coils, a new freezer and a new hanging scale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase mobile recharge cards to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et sont liés par une solidarité responsable.

Maimouna qui se trouve à droite de la photo,en position debout et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 48 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 07 enfants dont un garçon.

Son activité est le commerce de sucres,de thé et d'huile.Elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années ce qui fait qu'elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type de vente.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter un bidon de 20 litres d'huile,01 paquet de thé,5 kg de sucre et un mouton à 30000f.

Avec le bénéfice issu de la vente,elle compte augmenter son épargne et aider son mari à couvrir les dépenses liées à la nourriture de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in July of 2011. It is made up of members who live in the same village and are linked by their responsibility for their solidarity loan. 

Maimouna is the leader of the group, and is shown on the far right in the photo, standing and raising her arm. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, one of whom is a boy. 

Maimouna runs her business selling sugar, tea and oil. She has been in this business for several years, and so has good experience with this type of sales. 

With her loan, Maimouna will buy a 20-liter can of oil, one pack of tea, 5 kg of sugar, and a sheep for 30,000 francs XOF. 

With the income she earns from her sales, Maimouna plans to add to her savings and to help her husband pay for the expenses related to feeding their family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea, oil and a sheep.

loans.name: Agninefa

texts.fr: Agninefa est père de 4 enfants. Il exerce son activité à Akodessewa. Vu l’importance de son activité, il a payé plusieurs crédits déjà et compte dans cette activité plus de 5 ans d’expérience. Pour s’occuper de ses enfants, il fait la vente des tôles. Il achète en gros à SOTOTOLE et revend dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé. Pour répondre au mieux à la demande sans cesse croissante, il sollicite un troisième prêt. Le profit lui permettra de créer d'autres boutiques et mieux nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Agninefa is the father of four children. He conducts his business in Akodessewa. He has been in this business for five years and, in view of the importance of his work, he has already repaid several loans for his business.

To care for his children's needs, he has been selling sheet metal. He purchases the goods at wholesale from Sototole and resells the wares in a district of the city of Lome. In order to better meet growing demands, he is seeking his third loan. The income he earns with the help of this loan will allow Agninefa to create more shops and better feed his family.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Edoh a 34 ans, marié il a un enfant de 03ans en charge. Il vit dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé où il exerce son activité et compte dans cette dernière près de 05 ans. Il est technicien de profession mais associe à son activité principale la vente des produits d’alimentation générale Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et sollicite un cinquiéme prêt de WAGES pour augmenter son commerce et avoir un lendemain meilleur avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Edoh is 34 years old, married, and has a dependent three-year-old child. He lives in a district of the city of Lomé where he has been running his business for nearly five years. He is a technician by profession but in addition to his main job, he also sells groceries.

Edoh buys his supplies in the Lomé Grand Market, and is requesting a fifth loan from WAGES to expand his business and have a better tomorrow with his family.

loans.use: to purchase "pure water" (bags of water) and prepaid cell phone credit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Gunel

texts.en:
Gunel is a 31-year-old refugee who is married and mother of one child. The family has lived in an IDP settlement for a long time, and as parents try to provide their child with a bright future and education. The father of the family earns money working as a worker and Gunel is a gardener. She raises seasonal vegetables and greens in the backyard and sells them. She earns 150 AZN monthly, and this is the main source of income for the poor family.

Gunel has sold the harvest next to her house in a small grocery for eight years, and local people attend it very often. They know that she sells a quality and fresh harvest. Though Gunel loves gardening very much, the income from the grocery doesn’t cover her family’s demands. She has applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to by an additional small land for more vegetables and fruits. She wants to make a higher income, and to help her child to live a normal life as it was before they became refugees.

loans.use: to buy an additional small piece of land to grow more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr: Marié, papa d'un adorable enfant de 02ans, Mr Charles revend depuis un moment des matériaux d'électricité à touts personnes dans une boutique. N'arrivant plus à répondre aux besoins de ses derniers à cause du manque de marchandises, il sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour s'approvisionner en marchandises. il espère à l'avenir ouvrir une autre boutique et bien entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Married and the dad of an adorable 2-year-old, Mr. Charles has recently been selling electrical supplies and equipment to all comers in his shop. No longer able to respond to customer needs, due to a lack of merchandise, he is requesting his second loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. For the future, he hopes to open another shop and take care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Relwende Kaligri Group

texts.fr:
Mr Bangré est le représentant du groupe RELWENDE KALIGRI. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 06 enfants, le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 04 vont à l’école. Il a 09 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est jardinier depuis 40 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 01 sac d’engrais.
Mr Bangré veut épargnes ses bénéfices. Il compte renforcer son activité et Il ambitionne faire de l’élevage.
texts.en:
Mr. Bangré is the representative of the group RELWENDE KALIGRI. He is in good health. Married and a father, he has six children, of whom the oldest is 21 years old, and the youngest is 1. Four go to school. He has nine persons to support. 

Mr. Bangré has been a gardener for forty years. He gets his supplies from his district’s market. His customers are the residents of his district. He wants to purchase a sack of fertilizer. Mr. Bangré wants to save his profits. He is planning on bolstering his business. His ambition is to raise livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of fertilizer

loans.name: Wajdi

texts.en:
Wajdi is a 28-year-old, married man from a village near Tulkarm City. He lives with his wife and one small son in a very simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Wajdi is a student where he studies accounting. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future, so he can help his family to improve their living conditions. 

Wajdi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Wajdi will be able to write his research and seminars easily. Wajdi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 56-year-old refugee. She is married and raising three sons. Her elder son is married and lives together with her parents. Rahila is a farmer and has been raising fruits and vegetables for 15  years. She sells her harvest at the  local bazaar and her husband   and sons help her in this business. She gets additional earnings working as a laborer in her free time. The family gets 350 AZN monthly from selling the harvest but this is not enough to cover their needs.

The place where Rahila lives has a dry climate and she needs to build a greenhouse for fruits and vegetables. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to buy good garden tools and hire workers for building a greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy good garden tools and hire workers for building a greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy nets.

loans.name: Daudi

texts.en: Daudi is 62 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children.  He also supports four members of his family. He has a retail shop, which he has been running for 10 years now. He will be using this loan to buy more stock of goods such as sugar, salt, soap, rice and cooking fat. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. This is his eighth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and he repaid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Jhossen Brando

texts.es:
Jhossen es un joven emprendedor con muchos deseos de superación, se dedica a la venta de sogas en el mercado de su ciudad natal, Huaraz. Con el ingreso que obtiene por la venta de su mercadería apoya a sus padres, aún no puede estudiar una profesión porque en su hogar no alcanza el dinero más que para cubrir los gastos básicos, por eso se está esforzando bastante para sacar adelante a su familia.
Jhossen quiere ampliar su negocio, por ello con el préstamo va a comprar sogas para implementar su negocio y tener en stock para los pedidos. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, con esto su vida mejorará y más adelante podrá empezar a estudiar la carrera que tanto quiere.
texts.en:
Jhossen is a young entrepreneur with many desires to succeed.  He sells rope in the Huaraz local market, his home city.  He uses his income to support his parents and he is unable to attend school because there is not enough money in the home to cover the basic expenses.  He is striving to get his family ahead.

Jhossen wants to expand his business and will use the money from this loan to buy rope for his business and have enough in stock for his orders.  He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity.  His life will improve and he will be able to attend school in the future.

loans.use: to buy rope for resale.

loans.name: Songtaaba Sa Group

texts.fr:
Mme Félicité est responsable du groupe SONGTAABA SA. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24 ans et le moins âgés à 22 ans. 05 vont  à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme est productrice de boisson locale depuis 21 ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché environnant. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs de mil.
Mme Félicité  veut aider dans la scolarisions de ses enfants avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne accroitre son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Félicité is the official of the group SONGTAABA SA. Married and a mother, she has six children. The oldest is 24 years old, and the youngest is 22. Five go to school. She has six persons to support. 

Ms. Félicité has been producing local beverages for 21 years. She gets her supplies at the nearby market. Her customers are the residents of her district. She wants to purchase 10 sacks of millet. With her profits, Ms. Félicité wants to help provide schooling for her children. Her ambition is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of millet

loans.name: Fabio Alexander

texts.es:
Fabio a sus 22 años de vida nunca pensó lo difícil que es la vida como independiente y es que hace poco se mudó a vivir con su pareja de 18 años de edad (ver foto)  solos y apenas están sintiendo los rezagos de velar ellos por su bienestar. 
Fabio es un hombre maduro  y trabaja y viene ante la corporación interactuar a solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas y surtido para vender junto con su pareja los fines de semana. 
Pide ayuda a la comunidad Kiva a que apoyen a un hombre enamorado de su pareja que quiere formalizar una vida con ella y darle un bienestar económico.
texts.en:
Fabio is 22 years old and he never imagined how difficult life on his own would be, especially since he recently moved in with his 18 year old girlfriend (see photo).  They are just now beginning to feel the pressures of having to look out for their own wellbeing.

Fabio is a mature man and works is asking for a loan to buy a fast food truck and supplies so he and his partner can sell on the weekends.

He is asking the Kiva community for support for a man who loves his partner and who wants to build a life with her and provide her with financial wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a fast food truck.

loans.name: Haluna

texts.en:
Haluna is a married man living in a rural area with his family of seven children; five are orphans. He is a businessman who deals in hardware. He is however frustrated by limited capital and people ask for goods that he has not. 

He works six days and 16 hours per day and he started this business because he found it profitable.  He has acquired this loan in order to re-stock the hardware store with the items required by his customers.  He has hopes of buying a big piece of land to do farming. His clients are local residents. He is an honest and hard-working man, and he is grateful for the financial services rendered to him.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets and cement

loans.name: Welamita Silgo Group

texts.fr:
Mr Tankoudougou est le représentant du groupe WENDLAMITA SILGO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 07 enfants, le plus âgé a 33 ans et le moins âgé a 11 ans. 07 vont à l’école. Il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est agriculteur-éleveur depuis 45 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 06 moutons. 
Mr  Tankoudougou veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour se lancer dans la mécanique et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr, Tankoudougou is the representative of the group WENDLAMITA SILGO. He is in good health. Married and a father, he has seven children. The oldest is 33 years old, and the youngest is 11. Seven go to school. He has four person to support. 

Mr. Tankoudougou has been farming and raising livestock for 45 years. He gets his supplies from the nearby markets. His customers are the residents of his district. He wants to purchase six sheep. Mr. Tankoudougou wants to use his profits to get started in mechanics and to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase six sheep

loans.name: Gnima's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 14 janvier 1998, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices e revenus. Tous membres du groupement du vivent dans le même quartier et entretiennent des relations séculaires  de bon voisinage. De plus elles ont en majorité une grande expérience du système des bancs villageois.

Madame Gnima (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 31 ans et mère de 03 filles âgées de 03 à 12 ans. Elle tient une table au marché central où elle vend divers condiments et produits alimentaires (ognon, pomme de terre, huile végétale, bouillons culinaires, pâte d’arachide, piment, poivre et ail), qu’elle achète en gros pour la revente au détail. Elle fait se travail depuis plus de 05 ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter au moins 04 sacs d’ognons et de pomme de terre, 03 seaux de pâte d’arachide 04 bidons d’huile végétale de 20 litres et divers bouillons culinaires pour la revente. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des frais scolaires de ses filles.
texts.en:
Created on January 14, 1998, the ’banc villageois’ is composed of women highly dedicated to developing their revenue-generating businesses. All the group members live in the same district and maintain good neighborly ties. In addition, the women are for the most part very experienced in the ’banc villageois’ system [of savings and lending]. 

Ms. Gnima (sitting at the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. She is married, 31 years old, and the mother of three girls, aged 3 to 12. She has a table at the central market, where she sells a variety of condiments and provisions (onions, potatoes, vegetable oil, bouillons, peanut butter, chili peppers, black pepper, and garlic), which she sells in bulk for retail sale. She has been working for herself for over five years. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase at least 4 sacks of onions, 3 pails of peanut butter, 4 containers of vegetable oil, and four 20-liter containers of vegetable oil, and various flavorings for cooking, all to be resold. 

With the profits, she is planning to improve her family’s living conditions and to support her husband in covering her daughters’ schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase at least 4 sacks of onions, 3 pails of peanut butter, 4 containers of vegetable oil, and four 20-liter containers of vegetable oil, and various flavorings for cooking

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia hopes that her business will get bigger and bigger. She also wants her children to complete their schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Chapakazi Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her mid 30’s, is married with four children, two boys and two girls.  Two of them are still in school and the other two are grown-ups.  Anna has been running two projects, a beauty salon and mama lishe, for three years now.  She works from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Anna's fourth loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the hair project and opened a mama lishe business.  She is doing great with the loan and is grateful for Kiva's support of their group.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profits to reinvest in business.  She will use this loan to buy ingredient and charcoal for cooking.  She dreams of having her business grow.  

Anna will share this loan with her loan group "CHAPAKAZI," which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Kayitesi

texts.en: Kayitesi aged 57 years, she is married with 7 children aged between 10 and 29, and all of them go to school. She has been selling shoes for 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Dorries

texts.en:
Dorries is a married woman and has been blessed with three children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Dorries operated a poultry selling business. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Dorries dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is age 34, and she is a mother of three children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, and his relatives as well like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. 

Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Rubina requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Rubina hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way and that this amount will help him to cope with the demands of their family. Rubina thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Mahammadli

texts.en:
Mahammadli is 45 years old, married, and he has two children.  He is a refugee as are the other members of his family, and all of them live in an IDP settlement. His wife is a teacher and she helps the family as much as possible, but their main income comes from gardening. He has been raising and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables for 17 years. He has a good experience in gardening and his monthly income is 220 AZN.

Gardening is in high demand in Azerbaijan, because people use fresh fruits and vegetables for different tasty things. Mahammadli has a grocery at a local bazaar and sells the harvest there. His garden wasn’t productive enough this year. He has applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy good fertilizers to increase the harvest. He wants to increase the income and provide his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy good fertilizers to increase the harvest.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 38-year-old divorced woman. She lives with a son, a daughter and her parents. They all live in an IDP settlement because they are refugees.  She is a gardener and earns money for her family by growing seasonal fruits and selling them at a local bazaar. She has worked in this business for 10 years, and her monthly income is 170 AZN.

Growing and selling fruit is widespread in Azerbaijan. Every region has its specific kinds of fruits. For example, Samina sells grapes, pomegranates and apples.  She sells her harvest at a local bazaar every day.

Samina’s range of fruits to harvest is limited, and she can’t receive a high income. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to raise and sell other sorts of fruits. This will enlarge her assortment and increase the income of her family. Samina plans that this will help her to cover her family’s needs.

loans.use: to expand the range of fruits she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
Jorge es el propietario de un negocio muy querido por los campesinos y habitantes de puerto escondido y es un billar que pocos hay en el sector aquí los campesinos viene y se toman una cerveza y comparten con sus vecinos una partida de billar, este es de los pocos negocios que ofrecen algo diferente y un poco de diversión a este sector. 

Jorge pensando en sus clientes quiere realizar  mantenimiento a sus mesas de billares y el resto de dinero lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza y “aguardiente” la bebida tradicional de Antioquia. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio, compartir buenos momentos con sus vecinos y velar por el futuro de sus dos criaturas de 11 y 7 años de edad que son quienes le dan el aliento de trabajar todos los días.
texts.en:
Jorge is the owner of business that is cherished by the rural workers and residents of Puerto Escondido. It is a pool hall, and there are few in the area. Here, the rural workers come to have a beer and share a game of pool with their neighbors. This is one of few establishments in the area that offer something different and a little fun.

With his customers in mind, Jorge wants to perform maintenance on his billiards tables and will invest the rest of the money in the purchase of beer and “aguardiente,” the traditional drink of Antioquia. 

His dream is to carry on with his business, share some good times with his neighbors, and to provide a future for his two children, ages 11 and 7, who are his inspiration to work every day.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his billiards tables and purchase beer, creating a fun and recreational environment for his neighbors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Sirage

texts.en: Siraje is 52 years old, and he has eight children. He basically buys and sells meat. He began this business to support his family and meet their needs. He will use this loan to buy more cows. He is sure if he buys in bulk he will buy cheaply and therefore save more money. He hopes to have more butchers across the city. His challenge is price fluctuations. He is hard working.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter.

loans.name: Experito

texts.en: Experito is 30 years old, and he has two children aged two and four. His main business is a bar, and he is also a farmer. He began these businesses to be able to look after his family. He will use the loan to buy more beer and fertilizers. He hopes to eventually be in a better position to look after his family. His main challenge is fluctuating prices. He is hard working and honest.

loans.use: to buy beer and fertilizers.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 41 years old and married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with three children. She has a grocery business which she has been running for 12 years.

She will use this loan to buy vegetables like tomatoes, onions and carrots to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her 9th loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has successfully paid back all of her previous loans. Her future hopes are to expand her business and become self reliant.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine, have medical exams, and electroencephalograms.

loans.name: Dúo Luz San Antonio Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz San Antonio este grupo esta conformado por la señora Lesly Yeraldin de 25 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos ya que su venta ha aumentado y no tiene suficiente capital para agrandar mas su negocio, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Lesly Yeraldin, 25 years old, is a member of the group Duo Luz San Antonio.  She has been working at sale of cosmetics for several years.  At this time she is asking for the loan to buy cosmetics since her sales have grown and she doesn't have enough capital to grow her business.  She hopes for help with the loan requested.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is 49 years old and lives with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a mobile phone shop for couple of years and is earning sufficient income. He troubleshoots mobile phones, sells accessories such as chargers, bodies, data cable, etc., and provides the recharge facilities of different networks.

Nowadays there is so much increased demand for accessories and for recharging that sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest in his business because he has already spent all of his savings on household expenses.

Therefore, Khursheed has requested a loan for her son to empower him to buy additional accessories and extra credit for his recharge facility. Khursheed thanks Kiva and its field partner for this honourable support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories for her son's shop.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, a 46-year-old married father of three, has been operating a tailoring shop and selling clothes for 12 years. He will use this loan to buy more clothing stocks and tailoring materials such as fabrics and threads for use in his business. 

This is Vincent's first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business, and in the future he hopes to expand further and become more successful.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials and clothes for use in his business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, esta acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios domesticos en este tiempo de vivir juntos han procreado solamente un hijo de la edad de 3 años.

Juan lleva 18 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, lo aprendio por si solo. El lugar donde cultiva esta a unos 15 minutos de su casa, y se traslada caminando o en una bicicleta.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar sulfato, formula, fertilizantes, él es de escasos recursos economicos para poder comprar los fertilizantes, pero con el crédito se le facilitara y con lo que saque de la cosecha podra pagar el crédito.
 
Sus sueños son darle un mejor futuro a su familia y podra de esa manera sacarlos adelante y que Dios les de salud.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old, studied through second grade, and lives with his partner, who does housekeeping. They have one child together who is 3 years old. 

Juan has worked in farming for 18 years, which he learned on his own. The field he grows crops in is about 15 minutes from his home, which he gets to by bicycle or walking. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy sulfate, formula, and fertilizers. He currently doesn't have enough money to buy fertilizers, but the loan will provide him with the funds, which he will be able to pay back through his harvest.
 
His dreams are to provide a better future for his family, to be able to bring them up successfully, and for God to give them good health.

loans.use: to buy sulfate, formula, and fertilizers, as he currently doesn't have the funds to buy them.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas de 59 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, él no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que dice que sus padres lo mandaban a trabajar en vez de mandarlo a la escuela a que aprendieram por lo menos a escribir su nombre, hace cuarenta años se caso y ha procreado 10 hijos de las edades de 39, 38, 36, 34, 32, 30, 28, 26, 24, 22. su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos, cria animales como gallinas, patos, cerdos. Con él solo viven 5 hijos y su señora esposa.

Tomas cuenta con 45 años de dedicarse a la agricultura,tambien es carpintero. El trabajo de la milpa le queda como a dos cuadras de su casa, fue su padre quien le enseño esto, desde tiempos él decidio dedicarse a la siembra de maiz y frijol ya que no habia otra opción de como llevar dinero a casa para comprar los alimentos.

El préstamo que esta soliictando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizantes, sulfato para su cultivo de maíz y frijol. De esa manera se le facilita comprar porque él no tiene los recursos nesarios para abonar la milpa de no ser de esta manera no podra comprar los fertilizantes necesarios.

Sus sueños son sacar una buena cosecha, para tener recursos para darle una mejor vida a su familia en un futuro se le facilitara, al mismo tiempo va ampliar su siembra de maiz y frijol.
texts.en:
Tomas is 59 years old and he works as a farmer. He did not have the opportunity to go to school, because he says that his parents sent him to work instead of sending him to school to at least learn how to write his name. He got married 40 years ago and he has ten children, ages 22, 24, 26, 28, 30, 32, 34, 36, 38, 39. His wife is a home maker, raising animals such as hens, ducks and pigs. Only his wife and five of his children live with him.

Tomas has been farming for the past 45 years, and he is also a carpenter. The cornfield where he works is about two blocks from his house. His father taught him this work and since then he decided to grow corn and beans, since there was no other option of making money to buy food.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy fertilizers and sulfate for his corn and bean crops. That way the purchase will be easier for him, because he does not have the necessary resources to fertilize the cornfield. If it did not happen this way, he would not be able to buy the fertilizers needed.

His dreams are to have a good harvest and to have the resources to give his family a better life. In the future it will be easier for him, while he is going to increase the corn and beans he sows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and sulfate for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Gozal

texts.en:
Gozal is a 41-year-old married mother of three sons. The family is classified as IDP (internally displaced persons) and lives in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a laborer, but the family's main source of income is husbandry. Gozal breeds two cows for the purpose of making and selling dairy products (cheese, milk, butter). She earns 180AZN monthly for this. 

Husbandry is practised extensively in Azerbaijan, its productivity dependent on the area, location and climate. Very knowledgeable about husbandry because she has worked in this field for 15 years, Gozal makes delicious and fresh milk products.

Gozal is a very wise and responsible woman who loves her job very much; however, her efforts don't meet all of the family's needs. She has therefore applied for a 1500AZN loan in order to buy another cow to increase productivity and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy another cow to increase productivity for more income.

loans.name: Wendsongda Villa Group

texts.fr:
Mme Fati est la représentante du groupe WENDSONGDA VILLA. Elle se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère de 05 enfants, le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. 05 vont à l’école. Il a 17personnes en charge.
Madame est agriculteur depuis 30 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter 10 sacs de noyaux de karité et 40 sacs de céréales.
Mme Fati veut épargner  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité, améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et faire de l’élevage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fati is the leader of Wendsongda Villa Group. She supports herself very well. She is married and the mother of five children, the eldest of whom is 21 years old and the youngest of whom is eight. Five [of her children] attend school. Mrs. Fati has 17 people in her care.

Mrs. Fati has been a farmer for 30 years. She gets her supplies at the local market and her customers are the residents of her neighborhood. Mrs. Fati wants to purchase 10 sacks of shea nuts and 40 sacks of grain.

Mrs. Fati wants to save her profits. Her goal is to expand her business, improve her family's living conditions, and begin raising livestock.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of shea nuts and 40 sacks of grain.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar de 58 años de edad, es agricultor y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el quinto grado no continuo sus estudios por la economía en que Vivian sus padres y pues decidió abandonar la escuela y comenzar a trabajar para apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar, luego decidió acompañarse y es padre de 10 hijos de 30, 28, 26, 24, 22, 20, 18, 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, de los cuales viven con Oscar solo tres que aun siguen estudiando.

Su compañera de vida se dedica a la venta de pan por las mañanas y por la tarde para poder ayudar en los gastos familiares, mientras que Oscar se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre y por la misma necesidad económica, para llegar a su trabajo, Oscar viaja en bicicleta un kilometro, trabajando en el horario de 5:00 am a 12:00 m.d. todos los días, en ese horario también sus tres hijos le apoyan.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de ajonjolí, veneno, abono y para pago de mano de obra, donde espera poder obtener una linda cosecha y así podrá obtener un buen ingreso para los gastos del hogar y para pagar el crédito adquirido sin ningún inconveniente.

Oscar sueña con tener 50 animales, tener un carrito y tener una maquina industrial para moler el zacate.
texts.en:
Oscar, 58 years old, is a farmer. His level of study was up to the fifth grade. He did not continue his studies because of the economy in which his parents lived, and so decided to abandon school and begin to work to support his family paying home expenses. He later decided to enter a relationship and he is the father of 10 children, 30, 28, 26, 24, 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, and 12 years old, of which only three who are continuing to study live with Oscar.

His life partner makes a living selling bread in the mornings and in the afternoons to be able to help pay the family expenses. Meanwhile, Oscar has made a living in agriculture for 25 years, work that he learned from his father and for the same economic necessity. To get to his job, Oscar travels by bicycle a kilometer, working the schedule of 5:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. every day. In this schedule, his three sons also support him.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to purchase sesame, poison, and fertilizer, and to pay for labor, from which he hopes to be able to have a lovely harvest. He would then be able to earn a good salary to pay home expenses and to pay the loan acquired without any inconvenience.

Oscar dreams of having 50 animals, to have a cart, and to have an industrial machine to grind the fodder.

loans.use: to purchase sesame, poison, and fertilizer, and to pay for labor, from which he hopes to have a lovely harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nursing student supplies.

loans.name: Kogltaaba Villa Group

texts.fr:
Mme W. Yvonne est la représentante du groupe KOGLTAABA VILLA. Elle se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère de 05 enfants, le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle  a 05 personnes en charge.
Madame est productrice de boisson locale depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter 03 moutons et 03 sacs de mil.
Mme W. Yvonne veut épargner ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. W. Yvonne is the leader of Kogltaaba Villa Group. She supports herself very well. She is married and the mother of five children, the eldest of whom is 15 years old and the youngest of whom is three. Four [of her children] attend school. She has five people in her care.

Mrs. W. Yvonne has been a local drink producer for 10 years. She gets her supplies from the local market and her customers are the residents of her neighborhood.

Mrs. W. Yvonne wants to purchase three sheep and three sacks of millet. She wants to save her profits and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase three sheep and three sacks of millet.

loans.name: Aissatou Same's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 14 janvier 1998, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices e revenus. Tous membres du groupement du vivent dans le même quartier et entretiennent des relations séculaires  de bon voisinage. De plus elles ont en majorité une grande expérience du système des bancs villageois.

Madame Aissatou (assise à gauche avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée et mère d’une fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de crème glacée et glace dans la commune et les marchés hebdomadaires des environs. Pour se faire elle compte acheter en quantité du pain de singe, bissap, du sucre et divers colorants alimentaires.  Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter au moins 03 sacs de sucre, 04 sacs de pain de singe, 05 bassines de bissap et divers colorants et sachets. 

 Avec les bénéfices, elle prend en charge les frais scolaires de sa fille et soutient son mari à l’amélioration de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Established January 14, 1998, this banc villageois is made up of women who are highly engaged in business development. All of the group members live in the same neighborhood and maintain good neighborhood relationships. Furthermore, the majority of them have considerable experience with the banc villageois system.

Mrs. Aissatou (seated at left with one hand raised) is this group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of a daughter. Her business is in the sale of ice and ice cream in town and at nearby weekly markets. For [her business], she plans to purchase large quantities of baobab fruit, hibiscus flower, sugar, and various food colorants. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and enjoys much experience in this field.

With her new loan, Mrs. Aissatou plans to purchase at least three sacks of sugar, four sacks of baobab fruit, five bowls of hibiscus flower, and various colorants and bags. With the profits, Mrs. Aissatou will see to her daughter's school fees and support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase at least three sacks of sugar, four sacks of baobab fruit, five bowls of hibiscus flower, and various colorants and bags.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La Señora Natalia es de la ciudad de Asunción, es una persona de 50 años, anteriormente era ama de casa, pero ante la necesidad del día a día decidió ayudar a la familia montando un pequeño comedor en el mercado.
Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y hoy día ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre va a su comedor ya que sirve comidas muy ricas que gusta a sus clientes, es por medio de este trabajo que puede cubrir las necesidades de la casa y la familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sillas, mesas, y manteles, de manera a poder equipar su comedor, y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Natalia is from the city of Asunción. She is 50 years old and formerly a housewife, but in view of day-to-day needs she decided to help the family by setting up a small restaurant in the market. 

Over time she became well known and nowadays she has very good clients always coming back to her restaurant since she serves delicious food. She is able to meet the needs of the household and family through this work. 

She is requesting the loan to buy chairs, tables and tablecloths so that she can furnish her restaurant and offer good service to her customers. 

She is grateful for the opportunity received which will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and tablecloths.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina has paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from the store. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs. She had to work hard with the determination of having a better income.

To improve sales, Marina requested a new loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She will purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business and the general living conditions of her family.

Marina meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: “LA AMISTAD” es un grupo que está conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Maria es conviviente con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al tejido a máquina elabora chompas escolares a pedido. Y también elabora chompas para damas y caballeros. Para después expenderlos a sus conocidos y vecinos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de lana hilos botones. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Maria es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste chompa azul. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Valeria en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por estar atendiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
“La Amistad” is a group made up of members dedicated to retail sales. Maria, the third person from the lefthand side (wearing a blue sweater), has three dependent children. She works doing machine knitting, making school sweaters to order.  She also makes sweaters for women and men in order to later sell them to her acquaintances and neighbors.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of wool, thread, and buttons.  

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the granted loan. Note: Valerie’s photo can be seen in the upper left, because she couldn’t be present at the meeting, because she was attending to her business.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” son 18 señoras ellas poseen diversas actividades comerciales, y están poniendo su mejor empeño para poder salir adelante.
Lucia integra este grupo, y vende frutas variadas de estación, día a dia desde muy tempranas horas del día, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora que quiere poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas variadas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Los niños que aparecen en la foto son hijos de las integrantes del grupo, que siempre están con ellas.
texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) is made up of 18 women who work in diverse trades and are putting their determination forward to be able to come out ahead.
Lucia makes up a part of this group, and sells various fruits of the season, day to day from very early hours of the day, she is a self-sacrificing and fighting woman that wants to get ahead and help her family. 
She requests this loan to be able to buy various fruits, this way she can continue with her sales, helping her family through her job.
The children that appear in this photo are the children of the group members that are always with their parents.

loans.use: to buy various fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him as he was able to utilize his prior loan to purchase scrap materials needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

Jimmy requested another loan for 20,000 PHP, which he will use to buy scrap materials. His profits from his business will help him to sustain his family's daily needs and educational expenses of his children. Jimmy wants to expand his business as he desires to help others who are in need. He also aims to save for the future.  

Every week Jimmy meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purhcase recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Oscar Benjamin

texts.es:
Oscar Benjamín, es conviviente, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y menor hijo. Él vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú desde hace más de 10 años aproximadamente. Oscar Benjamín cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Oscar Benjamín se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas en su mismo domicilio. Desde hace más de 05 años. Él necesita del préstamo para la compra de ingredientes que utilizará en la preparación de hamburguesas, así como también invertir en la compra de bebidas gaseosas para complementar su servicio. El préstamo le ayudará a poder aumentar su producción y por ende sus ventas mejorar sus ingresos y aumentar sus ganancias, lo que en un corto plazo le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Benjamin lives in his own house with his partner and school-age son. He has lived in Cayaltí, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú for more than 10 years. Oscar Benjamin has good personal and work references and he lives in a community where most people work in commerce, agriculture, and cattle raising. 

For over five years, Oscar Benjamin has been selling hamburgers from his own home. He needs this loan to buy ingredients that he will use making hamburgers and sodas to serve with them. The loan will help him to increase production and sales and improve his profits. This will, in the short term, allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making hamburgers and also to buy soda to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for twenty years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Delia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.
