With PHP 20,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Delia hopes that her income from business will increase more and she also looks forward to their house renovation and beautification. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is married with kids. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees. 

She operates a poultry-selling business. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Lillian dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Эту деятельную женщину из северного города Худжанд зовут Саодат. Ей 43 года. Она замужем, мать двоих сыновей. Ее муж работает поваром, а сыновья помогают матери в ее бизнесе. 8 лет назад Саодат начала свой торговый бизнес в сфере продаж продуктов питания. Ее продуктовый магазин находится рядом с ее домом. Саодат всегда доброжелательна с клиентами и старается обслуживать их быстро и качественно. Поэтому у нее всегда достаточно клиентов. 
В данный момент Саодат решила расширить свой малый бизнес. Однако для этого ей не хватает денежных средств. Дело в том, что Саодат хочет приобрести холодильники для мороженного и для хранения прохладительных напитков. Для этой покупки она нуждается в 4500 долларов США. Саодат собирается получить эту сумму в кредит и очень надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
The name of this energetic woman from the northern [Tajik] town of Hujan is Saodat. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a cook, and her sons help their mother in her business. Eight years ago Saodat launched her own retail business  selling food items. Her grocery store is next to her home. Saodat is always friendly with her customers and makes an effort to provide quality fast service. This is why she always has plenty of customers.

At present Saodat has decided to expand her small business. However, she lacks the necessary funds for it. Saodat has decided to buy refrigerators for ice cream and soft drinks. For this purchase she needs 4,500 USD. Saodat plans to take out a loan for this amount and really hopes for your financial support.

loans.use: to buy refrigerators for ice cream and soft drinks.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria ella es soltero y tiene 61 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de madera, negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carros.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA.” This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member receiving this loan is señora Gloria. She is single, 61 years old, and has two children. She works in her business of selling grain. She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa. The member works from 8:00am to 5:00pm. She has worked for four years in this business and it goes very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the grain. The member requests the loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa. Her photo is added in the corner because she was not able to attend the meeting where the group picture was taken due to other work obligations. 

The other members work in the business of selling wood, photocopying, a grocery store, and car sales.

The member expresses thanks to those who form part of this dream through this medium, and she commits to fulfilling her payments on the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité de nombre Mujeres Luchadoras son 17 señoras que se esfuerzan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Miriam es vendedora de cosméticos y por medio de este humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera decorosa y con mucho sacrificio. Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante es por ello que se unió al grupo, para poder capacitarse.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por un futuro mejor. Los niños que aparecen en la foto son hijos de las integrantes del grupo, que siempre están con ellas.
texts.en:
The committee named Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) is made of 17 women who make an effort to better their life conditions through working together.
Miriam is a cosmetics seller, and through this humble job she earns a decent life with much sacrifice. She is a person who wants to get ahead, and it's for this reason that she joined the group, to be able to prepare herself.
She requests this loan to be able to buy various cosmetics, and this way she can continue with her sales, fighting for a better future.
The children that appear in the photo are the sons and daughters of the members in this group.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio es una joven emprendedora y luchadora, tiene 22 años de edad y trabaja como Enfermera en su ciudad natal, Pueblo Nuevo. El motor de su vida es su mamá, por ella siempre lucha porque quiere brindarle lo mejor del mundo y un futuro mejor. Gracias a todos los valores que su madre inculcó en ella desde pequeña es que hoy tiene un buen desempeño en el trabajo y siempre actúa con una ética intachable.
Rocio está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pagar su colegiatura, con ello crecerá profesionalmente y así más adelante podrá postular a mejores puestos de trabajo y así sacará adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Rocio is a young entrepreneur and hard worker. She is 22 and works as a nurse in her hometown of Pueblo Nuevo. The driving force in her life is her mom; she always works hard for her because she wants to provide her with the best things and a better future. Thanks to all the values her mother instilled in her since childhood, Rocio does very well at work and always acts according to impeccable ethics. 

Rocio is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as the support they have given will pay for her tuition, which will allow her to grow professionally, and can later apply for better jobs and thus bring forward her family.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her nursing degree.

loans.name: Astaluz

texts.en:
Astaluz is 50 years old, single with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is in goat rearing and selling a business she has been in for three years. She gets additional income form salary and farming (crop production). 

Astaluz begun the business to educate her children and support her family. Astaluz has a dream of educating her children. She is a hard-working woman with a challenge of limited capital. 

Astaluz needs money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Beatriz Adriana

texts.es:
Beatriz es una joven de 23 años de edad muy trabajadora, es enfermera y esta soltera. 

Beatriz aparte de ser enfermera también se dedica a la venta de queso fresco desde hace 4 años, trabajo que decidió aprenderlo de su madre para poder tener ingresos y así seguir estudiando. Para vender los quesos Beatriz viaja 90 kilómetros en bus trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 9:30 am de la mañana.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución es para la compra de leche para aumentar la venta de quesos, donde obtendrá un poco mas de ingresos para  ayudar en los gastos de su estudio y poder apoyar a sus padres.

Beatriz sueña con sacar la licenciatura en enfermería, tener su propia casa y tener un negocio más grande de queso.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking young lady of 23; she is a nurse and she is single. 

Aside from being a nurse, Beatriz has also worked selling fresh cheese for four years.  She decided to learn this business from her mother to be able to have income so she could continue to go to school.  To sell her cheese, Beatriz travels 90 km by bus, working from 7:00 am to 9:30 am in the morning. 

The loan she is requesting from the institution is to buy milk to increase her cheese sales, which will provide her with a little more income to help with her school expenses and to be able to help her parents.  

Beatriz dreams of getting her nursing degree, having her own home, and having a bigger cheese business.

loans.use: to buy milk to increase her cheese sales.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old. He has 6 children and he basically does brick-laying. He also sells charcoal. He began the business to supply construction materials. 

He will use the loan to buy firewood, pay labourers, pay rent for the land. He hopes that all his children will get education. His challenge is heavy rains. 

He is hardworking and honest. He is grateful for the financial support. In the picture is John with the Ugafode credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: to buy firewood and hire labour.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is 49 years old and has 3 children. His main business is agriculture and he grows ginger. He began the business to have a monthly income and to raise tuition for his children. He will use the loan to complete the  construction of his  house. 

He hopes to give his children a bright future and save for old age. He faces challenges of pests, rents costs, and harsh weather conditions. He is hard working and patient.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, plaster and shutters.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, in which he sells artificial jewelry such as rings, earrings, bangles, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case, for the attraction of customers.

He is the family's sole source of income: he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his children, and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan funds so her husband can buy precious jewelry, which will enable him to increase his earnings.

Shehnaz hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members may pass their lives comfortably. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy artificial jewelry such as rings, earrings, bangles, and necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise chickens.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 20-year-old hard working woman who lives in the town of Arua 1 in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. 

Joyce has been a tailor as well as a retail shop owner for 3 years.

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy Tailoring items like threads, machine, materials and cooking oil, flour, sugar, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and educate her children. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on her business. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for the new planting season.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. 

For the past 25 years, Zaituni has been working hard to manage her business which sells baskets,mats, papyrus reeds. 

To help expand her business, Zaituni has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more baskets,mats, papyrus reeds, and it will help Zaituni to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Zaituni hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land. 

Zaituni is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zaituni who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy craft items like baskets,mats, papyrus reeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and cereals for resell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in Dumingag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has a small  sari-sari store. She has had this business for 35 years and she wants to  farm to earn additional income. 

She requests a loan to pay for land and planating preparations. Lucy has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to start another business for additional income.

loans.use: to pay for land and planting preparation

loans.name: Mackrina

texts.en:
Mackrina has children that attend school and are  under her care.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Mackrina has operated a business to sell clothes at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. A major business  challenge to be seasonality. Mackrina dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase bulk quantities of clothes t re-sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma  de 58 años de edad, es madre soltera  y tiene casa propia, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de tamales de gallina, pan, etc.
Doña Vilma  sus clientes son los amigos y personas que la conocen y que ella visita en sus casa, es una mujer  trabajadora que se ha dedicado toda su vida a la elaboración de estos productos ya que cuando paso el huracán Mitch perdió todo,  pero a pesar de todo salió adelante y ahora vive en mejores condiciones.
Doña Vilma  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de mas productos como ser harina de pan, huevos, gallinas, hojas, leña, condimentos, etc. está muy contenta por el apoyo de  Prisma en su negocio, es su quinto préstamo que solicita  es un excelente cliente, su sueño es seguir mejorando su casa y también su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 58-year-old single mother who has her own house. She doesn't have dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in the Valle department, in the south of Honduras. For 10 years she has worked selling tamales (traditional dishes of dough cooked in leaf wrappers) consisting of chicken, bread, etc.

Vilma's customers are friends and people who know her and and whom she visits at their homes. She is a hard-working woman who has worked all her life making these products and who lost everything when Hurricane Mitch passed over. Yet in spite of everything, she managed to get ahead, and now lives in better conditions.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy more products such as bread flour, eggs, chickens, leaves, firewood and condiments. She is very pleased with the support provided by Prisma for her business. This is her fifth loan cycle; she is an excellent customer. Her dream is to carry on improving both her home and her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014.

loans.use: to buy items such as bread, eggs, chickens, leaves, firewood and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for the new planting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fruits to resell to earn more income

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida enjoys her gardening activities. Gardening is both her hobby and a source of income. 

She is a 57-year-old married woman who can sufficiently provide for the family. She is a full pledge member of PMPC and credits the cooperative for providing the capital to support her gardening activities. 

She applied for a loan to purchase gardening pots and an insecticide sprayer. In the future, Aida wishes to become a flower supplier in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening pots and a sprayer for insecticides.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is a farmer from Rizal and earns well doing this type of work. He approached Paglaum for a loan to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer. 

Artemio hopes to purchase a  truck to  easily deliver his produce in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nuris

texts.es: Desde muy joven, Nuris, una mujer de 35 años, siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de diversos artículos, pero solo hasta hace 2 años, pudo reunir un buen capital y ubicarse en un local que surtió con diversas mercancías como ropa, maletines, accesorios femeninos artículos de papelería etc. Cada momento es diferente, pues los artículos uno a uno tienen su temporada en las cuales la clientela compra en mayor volumen. Como se acerca la temporada de fin de año, donde la población tiene recursos para comprar, producto de sus primas, bonificaciones etc. Nuris necesita invertir en todo lo necesario para impactar a sus clientes y aprovechar el repunte de sus usuales ventas en el último trimestre del año. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikikva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará papel de regalo, adornos navideños, accesorios para el hogar y ropa, para que las familias vistan con trajes nuevos las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo, época en las cuales entre música y sonrisas    las campanas avisan que ha llegado un año más, las parejas, hijos hermanos amigos se abrazan se besan para despedir el viejo año y darle la bienvenida al nuevo. .
texts.en:
Nuris is 35 years old and has been selling various articles since she was very young, but was only able to save enough money to set up in a location within the past two years, and stock it with clothing, brief cases, ladies’ accessories, paper goods, etc.  Every moment is different because there is a season for each article and she buys them in quantity.  Since the end of the year season is approaching, and people have more resources from bonuses, etc. Nuris needs to buy everything she needs so she can take advantage of her end of years sales.

For this reason she is requesting her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so she can buy wrapping paper, Christmas decorations, household accessories, and clothing, so that families can visit each other with new Christmas and new year outfits.  This is a time of music and smiles, when the bells announce another year, couples, children, brothers and sisters, and friends hug one another to welcome the New Year and say goodbye to the old.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Nalak Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thongkham's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Mrs. Thongkam is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Josphine. She is a 28-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kerugoya, which is a small rural town in central Kenya. Josphine and her husband are blessed to have a child. Josphine has been a mixed-farmer for more than 4 years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows tea and vegetables for sale. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path.  Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Josphine is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya.
  
Josphine is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Josphine seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kerugoya and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my child.”

loans.use: to grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 38-year-old married hardworking woman who helps her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She wants to provide better opportunities for her children and she works extremely hard to keep her children smiling.

She started sewing clothes after the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. Then she decided to start a tailoring business at home. She has been sewing clothes for her community and wants to enhance the beauty of her craft so she would like to buy a Juki industrial sewing machine. The professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives, and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

Abida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki machine for tailoring services.

loans.name: Carmen Magdalena

texts.es:
Carmen de 35 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el tercer año de bachillerato; luego decidió casarse y ahora es madre de un hijo de 12 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como tomate, chile verde, cebolla, pepino y pipián, mientras que Carmen se dedica a la atención de una tiendita que tiene y un cafetín en el centro escolar de la comunidad, desde hace 10 años trabajo que lo aprendió por la misma situación económica en que se encontraba. Para llegar a su negocio Carmen camina 2 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta adquiriendo en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una novilla y para invertir un poco en el negocio de su tiendita, comprar algunos dulces, churros, lejía y jabón, así mejoraran sus ingresos y siendo así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Carmen es comprar un vehículo para trasladar su mercadería hacia su cafetín y darle a su hijo mucho estudio hasta que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Carmen is 35 years old; she is a homemaker, and she attended school through her third year of high school, at which point she decided to get married, and she is currently the mother of a 12-year-old son.  Her husband grows vegetables, such as tomatoes, green chiles, onions, cucumbers, and pumpkins, for a living while Carmen has run a small store with a canteen at the local school for 10 years.  She learned this work because of financial necessity.  To get to her business Carmen walks 2 km, working from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm. 

The loan she is getting from CREDICAMPO is to buy a heifer and to invest a little in her canteen business by buying some candy, churros, bleach, and soap, and to thereby improve her earnings and be able to offer her family a better quality of life. 

Carmen's dream is to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise to her canteen and to provide her son with a lot of education until he becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and to invest a little in her canteen business by buying some candy, churros, bleach, and soap.

loans.name: Urunana Cb A Group

texts.en: Anastasie is a group leader aged 38. She is married with 3 children aged between 14 and 5 years; all of them go to school. The group is called URUNANA which means “They believe each other” in English. She sells sorghum and has been selling for the past 3 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used for the family welfare and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Azucena Carolina

texts.en:
Azucena Carolina is 32 years old, is unmarried, and lives with her family. In addition to her job as a secretary in a government institution, she has made a living running a small liquor store to generate income for her family. She dreams to become financially stable to expand her business to uplift the living status of her family and support her family with only her business.

She aims to continue and improve her business and increase her sales but she has insufficient capital to do so. For this reason, Azucena would like a loan of MXN5,000 to purchase beverages wholesale in order to have more inventory and sell with a better margin.

This is Azucena Carolina's first loan with Konfío and considers herself a very responsible person when managing credits.

loans.use: to buy beverages wholesale for her small liquor store.

loans.name: Centro De Rioyos Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Centro de Rioyos” está conformado por tres integrantes pertenecientes a una comunidad mazahua donde muchos de los habitantes aún conservan muchas de sus tradiciones como el idioma y ropa: las mujeres llevan su traje típico y collares coloridos que hace que aun hacen mas hermoso su vestimenta. 

Los integrantes del grupo son muy amigos, su relación es sólida ya que se conocen desde tiempo atrás. Agustina y José Ángel tienen una tienda de abarrotes y quieren invertir en más mercancía. Mientras que Jorge se dedica a la herrería.

Jorge es el representante del grupo, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus hermanos y mamá. Hace algunos años su papá falleció y el quedó a cargo de su familia ya que es el hermano mayor. Durante muchos años su papá se dedicó a la herrería creando puertas y ventanas así que al pasar horas enteras en el taller desde pequeño, aprendió muy bien el oficio. A Jorge le gusta trabajar en su negocio no solo porque de ahí obtiene ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar sino porque es el negocio que alguna vez inició su papá y le tiene un cariño muy significativo. 

El único problema al que se enfrenta es la falta de espacio en el taller que además está al aire libre y no tiene cuenta con mucha seguridad. “Una de mis metas es tener un negocio mas grande para darle empleo a otras personas que lo necesitan". 

Jorge necesita invertir en fierro y más material para continuar creando puertas y ventanas.

*En la imagen: Jorge es el más joven de los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
The Centro de Rioyos Group is made up of three members who belong to a Mazahua community where many of the residents still maintain many of their traditions, such as their language and clothing:  the women wear traditional dresses and colorful necklaces that make their clothing even more beautiful.  

The group members are close friends; their relationships are solid, as they have known each other for some time now.  Agustina and José Ángel have a grocery store and they want to invest in more merchandise, while Jorge works as a blacksmith.  

Jorge is the group's representative; he is 27 years old, single, and lives with his brothers and his mother.  His father passed away a few years ago and he was left to take care of his family, as he is the oldest brother.  His father worked as a blacksmith for many years, making doors and windows, and so after entire hours in the workshop since he was young, he learned the profession very well.  Jorge like to work at his business not only because it provides him with income to cover his household expenses, but also because it is the business that his father started and so it is very dear to him.  

The only problem he faces is a lack of space in his workshop, which is in the open air and does not have much security.  "One of my goals is to have a bigger business to offer employment to people who need it."

Jorge needs to invest in iron and more material to keep making doors and windows.  

*In the photo: Jorge is the youngest of the group's members.

loans.use: to buy iron and material for doors and windows

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: Sahla

texts.en:
Sahla is 36 years old, married, and she has two kids. For many years Sahla has worked in farming, with her main crop being lemons.  The work is going very well as she has many years' experience and because she always worries about giving her customers the highest quality products. But she has a problem with water because every time she gets water from a neighbor. For this reason she is asking for a loan 1,500 AZN so that she can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand her lemon crops.

Sahla is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a water pump.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail is a 40-year-old married Ugandan male living in Kagadi. He has operated a hardware shop since 2008 to increase his income. Ismail is hard-working and desires to build a residential house. Ismail is challenged by high transport costs and competition for market. He is acquiring a loan to buy cement, nails, and iron sheets for selling.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails, and iron sheets for selling.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 49 años de edad, es agricultor y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el sexto grado, no continuo sus estudios porque decidió mejor trabajar para apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar, esta casado y junto con su esposa tiene 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 9 años de edad de los cuales solo el pequeñito estudia los otros dos trabajan y tienen su propio hogar, con Juan vive su hijo de 9 años y su esposa.

Su esposa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, mientras que Juan es empleado de la alcaldía de su comunidad y también se dedica a la siembra de maíz (agricultura) desde hace 30 años trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres y por la necesidad en que vivían, Juan para llegar a su trabajo viaja en bus 4 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 8:00 am a 3:00 pm.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución de CREDICAMPO, es comprar algunos materiales como piedra, cemento, arena y ladrillo para empezar a construir su vivienda de ladrillo, ya que en la que reside es de adobe y esta en malas condiciones.

Juan sueña con que su hija estudie mucho para que en un futuro sea una persona de bien y tenga buenas posibilidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is a 49-year-old farmer with a 6th grade education. He didn't continue his studies because he thought it would be better to work to help his parents with household expenses.  He is married and he and his wife have three children who are 19, 17 and 9 years old. Only the youngest one is in school; the other two work and have their own homes. Juan lives with his wife and 9-year-old. His wife sells fruits and vegetables, while Juan works for the local government and also grows corn which is something he has been doing for 30 years. He learned this trade from his parents due to the necessity of their living situation. Juan works from 8:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. and travels 4 km. by bus to get to his job.

Juan is asking CREDICAMPO for a loan so that he can buy materials such as stone, cement, sand and bricks to begin to build a brick house.  The one he lives in now is made of adobe and is in poor shape. Juan's dream is that  his 9-year-old studies a lot so that she will grow up to be a respectable person with good job prospects.

loans.use: to buy stone, cement, sand and bricks to begin building a brick house. His current house is made of adobe and is in poor condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at herr home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Noi's Group

texts.en:
Noi is 43 years old. She lives in a rural area near Ha Noi and has three children. Noi’s husband is a worker while she runs a food stall. She has been doing this job for 10 years. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 8,000,000 per month.

Noi has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed VND 11,118,000 and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 12,426,000 to buy more food for her stall.

Noi's challenge in life is shortage of financial capital to expand her business. She wishes that she could generate enough profit so she would not have to borrow money.

Other members of Noi's Group are included in the following list:

1. Min is 45 years old. She is the mother of three. She is requesting a loan of 8,938,000 to raise chickens.

2. Huong is 40 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow VND 7,194,000 to run a grocery.

3. Vuong is 56 years old. She has two children. She is applying a loan of 10,246,000 to raise chickens.

4. Ty is 45 years old. She is the mother of two. She would like to borrow VND 6,322,000 to raise chickens.

5. Ty is 61 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 11,990,000 to rebuild her bathroom.

loans.use: to buy more food for her stall

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замире 40 лет. Она родом из села района Спитамен, где живет с мужем, 19-летней дочерью и 13-летним сыном. Ее муж водитель и зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси. А Замира при дворе дома имеет скотный двор и в течение 9 лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатых скотин, и в основном для откорма берет молодых бычков с целью дальнейшего продажи. 
В данный момент Замира собирается увеличить поголовье скотов для развития бизнеса. Она берет кредит, чтобы приобрести пару крупнорогатых скотин. Замира сможет реализовать свою цель только при вашей поддержке. Она хочет таким образом увеличить доход от бизнеса и улучшить экономическое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Zamira is 40 and a resident of the Spitamen region, where she lives with her husband, 19-year-old daughter and 13-year-old son. Her husband is a driver and earns a living through his taxi business. Zamira works from home raising cattle, a business she has had for nine years. Her animal husbandry business primarily involved buying young steers for fattening and resale.

At the moment, Zamira is working on increasing her head count of livestock to develop her business. She is requesting a loan to buy two head of cattle. She will be able to realize her plans only with your support. She wants to use this loan to increase profits from her business and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle to develop her business

loans.name: Houma's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 14 janvier 1998, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices e revenus. Tous membres du groupement du vivent dans le même quartier et entretiennent des relations séculaires  de bon voisinage. De plus elles ont en majorité une grande expérience du système des bancs villageois.

Madame Houma (assise à droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est veuve et prend à sa charge 02 de ses filles et petites filles. De plus elle est membre du comité de gestion de son banc villageois et joue un rôle très déterminant dans le fonctionnement de ce dernier. Elle est vendeuse de jus de fruit à base de produits locaux, de crème glacée, et divers produits agricoles. Elle vient de commencer la fabrication et la vente de savon traditionnel activité qu’elle a repris.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 04 bidons huile de palme, 10 kg de soute, 10 kg de farine et 02 sacs de 25 kg de sel et autres produits chimiques pour la production de savon.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte apporter une meilleure gestion des charges de la famille. De plus sa petite sœur qui est actuellement à la maison.
texts.en:
Created on January 14, 1998, this banc villageois is composed of women who are very engaged in their businesses. All group members live in the same neighborhood and maintain good social ties. In addition, most of them already have plenty of experience with the banc villageois model.

Mrs. Houma (the one seated on the right raising her hand) is the star borrower of this group. She is a widow taking care for two of her daughters as well as her granddaughters. She is also a member of the leadership committee of her banc villageois and plays an important role in shaping its course. She sells fruit juice prepared of local fruits, ice cream, and various agricultural products. She just started making traditional soap for sale, as she used to do in the past. With her new loan, she plans to buy four jugs of palm oil, 10 kg [22 lbs] of lye, 10 kg [22 lbs] of flour, two 25-kg  [55 lbs] bags of soul, and other chemical ingredients needed for the production of soap. With her revenues, she hopes to be able to manage household expenses better. She is also providing for her younger sister, who currently lives with her.

loans.use: to buy four jugs of palm oil, 10 kg  of lye, 10 kg  of flour. two 25-kg   bags of soul, and other  ingredients  for the production of soap.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc village a été créé le 22 Avril  2007,  il regroupe des femmes qui partagent des liens de solidarité très solide du fait de leur compagnonnage pendant plus de cinq bonnes années soit 13 cycles actuellement. Les membres sont désireux de développer des activités génératrices de revenus ainsi améliorer les conditions d’existence facilitant l’accès aux produits de consommation courante. Ces femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, elles pratiquent aussi la culture sous pluies.

Madame Aissatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de trois  enfants dont deux garçons et une fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits de consommation courant et de pétrole à usage domestique. Pour se faire elle achète des bidons de 20 litres qu’elle revend par ¼ de litre, demi-litre et litre selon les besoins du client. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de l’activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte acheter au moins 03 bidons de 20 litres et divers autres produits de consommation courante pour la revente.

Les bénéfices qui découleront de ces activités lui permettront d’augmenter son épargne et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This banc village was created on 22 April 2007. It is made up of women who share very strong ties of solidarity, which has grown from their companionship over the last five years. The group is now on their 13th loan cycle.

The group members wish to develop their businesses and improve their living conditions by facilitating access to consumer goods. These women work primarily in small-scale commerce, but they also engage in rain-fed agriculture.

Aissatou (who is seated on the far right [of the photo] with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and a mother of three children, two boys and one girl. 

Aissatou works selling consumer goods and gas to be used in the home. To do this, she buys 20-liter drums [of gas] and sells it by the quarter liter, half liter, or liter according to the needs of the customer. She does well with this business, which she has done for a number of years.

With this new loan, she plans to buy at least three 20-liter drums [of gas] and some other various consumer goods which she will resell.

Earnings will allow her to increase her savings and help her husband with the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy at least three 20-liter drums [of gas] and other various consumer goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television for his son.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She lives at a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a stall to sell fruits and vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonal changes in her business. 

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase oranges, bananas, and green vegetables. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of oranges, bananas, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi  has operated a retail shop business selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She expresses appreciation for the support of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Héctor Iván

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Héctor es un hombre que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, el siempre está dispuesto a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para desplazarse a distintas fincar para cumplir con obligaciones laborales. 

Este oficio lo alterna con la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas y adicional a esto tiene unos pequeños cultivos de plátano que también vende en la plaza de mercado.

El desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insumos una vaca lechera y asi mejorar su negocio de manera sustancial.
texts.en:
Farm work is one of the most difficult kinds of work these days because of the great effort needed to make progress, but Héctor is a man who has never given up, despite the weather or circumstances that might arise; he is always willing to generate income for his family.  

He gets up at the crack of dawn to travel to different farms to fulfill his work commitments.  

He alternates this work with selling milk that he gets from his own cows and, additionally, he has some small banana crops that he also sells at the marketplace.  

He wants to increase his work capital to ensure that his businesses are supported and that is why he is requesting a loan to invest in supplies and a dairy cow to thereby improve his business substantially.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to improve his production

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 47 años de edad, estudió hasta 1° grado, no pudo continuar por la situación económica de sus padres, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene 4 hijos y todos ya se acompañaron.

Ana se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años, aprendió el oficio por medio de una vecina, además los fines de semana hace tamales, nuégados y enchiladas para vender, y el trabajo lo hace en casa todos los días desde las 9 am a 4 pm. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar maíz y leña para la elaboración de tortillas.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando con su negocio y que vaya creciendo para solventar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 and studied up to first grade. She was not able to carry on with her schooling because of the economic situation of her parents. She lives with her partner, who is a farmer, and they have 4 children who all live on their own with their partners.

Ana has worked making tortillas for 4 years. She learnt the job with the help of a neighbour. On the weekends she also makes tamales, nuégados (a traditional dessert) and enchiladas to sell. She works from home every day from 9 am until 4 pm.

She needs the loan to buy maize and firewood in order to make tortillas. Her dream is to carry on working in her business, and she hopes it will continue to grow to cover the household costs.

loans.use: to buy maize and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university expenses for this semester.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 46 years old. She is married, has two kids and is a resident of Lawag Galas Dipolog City Zamboanga del Norte Philippines. Her husband is a construction worker. She earns a living from her sari-sari store in order to help her family. 

In 2010, she became a member of Paglaum MPC and enjoys her membership and maintain her status as a member in good standing. Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

location.town: Dipolog City-Lawag Galas Dipolog City Zamboanga de

loans.name: Los Luchadores Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Los Luchadores, lo integran tres socios quienes se esfuerzan cada día para brindarle el pan de cada día a su familia, este grupo es coordinado por la señora Kenia, quien tiene la edad de 25 años, acompañada y dedicada a la comercialización de sandalias en su domicilio, es el tercer ciclo que solicita el financiamiento de la institución para la compra de sandalias bajas y altas, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado aumentar los productos ofrecidos. El resto de los integrantes es el señor Francisco quien tiene la edad de 29 años y se dedica a la comercialización de marisco en su domicilio y la señora Verónica de 38 años de edad, comerciante de frutas en su comunidad.
texts.en: The Los Luchadores Solidarity Group is made up of three member who make and effort every day to provide their families with their daily bread.  This group is coordinated by Kenia, who is 25 years old, in a relationship, and sells sandals from her home for a living.  This is the third cycle in which they are requesting a loan from the institution to buy heeled and flat sandals; with her previous loans this group member was able to increase the number of products she offers.  The rest of the members are Francisco, who is 29 and sells seafood from his home for a living, and Verónica, who is 38 years old and sells fruit in her community.

loans.use: to buy sandals

loans.name: Furaha Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Hassan, who was born 1971, is married and has two sons who are at school. He is a businessman running a shop selling sugar, rice, beans, maize, baking flour, cooking oil and so on. He has been in this enterprise for ten years now; a business he has chosen as being good for his life. He works from 07:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

Hassan is a member of Furaha Tegeta, a group consisting of two members. The group members are of the same age and their dreams are to change their business and family welfare. As a group, they approached Tujijenge, a Kiva partner, and previously received some credits which showed some positive impact on their businesses. They believe that by receiving additional credit support, their businesses will grow and be in a good position. 

Hassan used the previous credits, since repaid, to buy three acres of farmland which he needed to practice commercial farming. He wants to grow grains, cassava and pineapples. He also bought sugar, baking flour, beans, maize meals and rice for his food shop. With good management, he earned additional income which he used to cover home costs and school fees. 

Hassan is requesting his 23rd credit from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among the two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Hassan will invest his portion of the new credit request to do farming, growing grains, cassava and pineapples for his business.

He is so thankful for Kiva lender's support.

loans.use: to grow grains, cassava and pineapples for his business.

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en:
Baltazar is 40 years old and lives in Tambulig, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married with two children. Baltazar has one hectare of rice fields and has had this farming business for 17 years. 

He requested a loan to prepare the seedbeds for the the next cropping season. Baltazar has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future he hopes that his children have a stable job.

loans.use: to prepare seedbeds.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 21 years old. She is married, has one child and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a retail shop. After reconciling with her husband, Joseline carried on her dream of building a permanent house for herself and the family. 

Joseline is a hard-working woman with a focused mind and she is looking forward to expand her business. Joseline wants money to buy sand and cement to complete her residential house.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to complete her residential house.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George deals in produce-selling and farming in Kagadi, Uganda to raise income for the family. He is married and hopes to grow his business since he is hard-working despite the challenges of competition hindering his dream. 

George is asking for a loan to buy maize, cassava and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, cassava and rice to sell.

loans.name: Rasmas

texts.en: Rasmas is a married man operating a mini depot, rentals and farming in Kagadi, Uganda. Despite his hard work, he is challenged by competition and desires to grow his business. For this reason, Rasmas is asking for credit to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 30-year-old hard working woman. She has a retail shop in a trading center and her shrewdness and  good customer service has attracted a large customer base. She sells corn flour, rice, sugar and other items that are demanded by the community. 

She will use the loan to buy items for the business. She hopes to have a whole sale shop in the near future to increase her profit. Her challenge is high competition. 

She thanks kiva lenders for supporting small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Leonidas Apolonio

texts.es:
Leonidas de 54 años de edad, es un señor muy dedicado a su trabajo, es agricultor y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el quinto grado, no continuo sus estudios por la economía y decidió mejor trabajar para ayudar a su familia en los gastos de la alimentación, esta casado y junto con su esposa tiene 3 hijos de 26, 20 y 5 años de edad de los cuales solo una esta a cargo de él porque los demás ya están acompañados.

 Su esposa se dedica a la venta de quesos frescos, mientras que Leonidas se dedica al negocio de venta de animales desde hace 4 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus amigos y por la necesidad en que vivían, decidió dedicarse a esto porque le da ganancias suficiente para el bienestar de su familia y para poder pagar sus créditos adquiridos, también se dedica a la agricultura la cual le deja también ganancias, Leonidas para llegar a su trabajo camina 3 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 3:00 pm, todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución de CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de 4 animales, así mejorara su negocio y podrá obtener mas ingresos para poder darle a su grupo familiar una mejor calidad de vida.
El sueño de Leonidas es aumentar la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Leonidas is 54 years old. He is very dedicated to his job. He is a farmer, and he only completed the 5th grade in school. He didn't complete school because of the financial situation. He decided to work to help his family with the food expenses.

He is married and they have 3 kids, who are 26, 20, and 5 years old respectively. He only takes care of one of them, because the other two are already married.

His wife sells queso fresco (fresh cheese) while Leonidas has been selling animals for 4 years. He learnt this job from his friends, for the necessities they had. He decided to work in this field because he can make the necessary income to support his family and to be able to pay off his loans.

He also works as a farmer, he makes also an income through this occupation. Leonidas walks 3 kilometers each day to get to work. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. every day. The loan he is requesting to CREDICAMPO is to buy 4 animals, he'll improve his business that way. He'll also be able to get a better income and offer his family a better quality of life. 

Leonidas's dreams is to increase the animals breeding.

loans.use: to buy  4 animals.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima previously accessed a loan that she used to buy additional food stuff for her retail shop. Her earnings helped with her children's education expenses  and personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another a 20,000 KES loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. 

She looks forward to this financial support with happiness and thankfulness.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Fawziya

texts.en:
Fawziya is a 30-year-old married mother of one child who has been selling beauty cosmetics and perfumes from her house since 2009 in order to support her husband in covering the increasing living needs of their family.

Fawziya is a hard worker who puts very much effort into developing her business and replying to her customers' increasing requests. For this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a newly-released autumn collection. She hopes that in the future, she can develop and expand her business and open her own separate shop outside her house.

loans.use: To purchase a newly-released autumn collection of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 68 years old. She is a widow, has 2 kids and is a resident of Lawag Galas Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. Hearing all the programs and services of Paglaum MPC, she never hesitated to become a member. 

In 2006, she became a member of the Cooperative, and she maintains the status of being a member in good standing. Recently, she decided to a apply for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase piglets for hog-fattening. She hopes to commercially sell meat in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for hog-fattening.

location.town: Dipolog-Lawag Galas Dipolog CityZamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Merygrace

texts.en:
Merygrace is 24 years old, married and has a child. She lives at Peñablanca. Merygrace has been in her business for three years. She uses her income for school fees and daily meals at home. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy peanuts, mangoes, eggplant and tomatoes to sell. She hopes to increase her profits from her small business and continue making her business profitable. 

She will save the additional revenue for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, mangoes, eggplant, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Fidencia

texts.en:
Fidencia is 62 years old. She is married, has 3 kids and is a resident of Lower Banicapt Galas Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is painter. 

In 2006, she became a member of Paglaum MPC. She enjoys the programs and services that the cooperative offers and she maintains her status of a member in good standing. Recently, Fidencia decided to apply for a loan to purchase textiles, buttons and thread.

loans.use: to purchase textiles, buttons and thread.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
In 2012, Edna learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance to microfinance members like her. Edna tried her luck on doing gardening activities. 

Edna took a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her gardening income a big boost. Edna looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Marie Cris

texts.en:
Marie Cris is 29 years old from the community of Dulag, Leyte. She has two children aged 2 and 4. Marie Cris is engaged in multiple businesses such as food vending, a sari-sari (variety) store and transportation using her potpot (a bicycle with an attached sidecar and third wheel, for transporting passengers). 

Marie Cris works hard for her children. She is asking for a loan to buy stocks of noodles, chips, condiments, candies, seasoning, canned goods and vegetables. Once her stocks are available, she can maximize her profit from her sales because sometimes she does not have much to offer.

Marie Cris hopes to expand her business so she can provide healthy meals and save for her children's education someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of noodles, chips, condiments, candies, seasoning, canned goods and vegetables.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is 44 years old, married and, together with his spouse, has been blessed with one child. He has a hotel and has been in the business for 12 years. It has been profitable.

This is his second loan term and he will be using this loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, potatoes and charcoal for use in his hotel. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

His future hopes are to grow his hotel business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, potatoes and charcoal.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 47 years old. He is married, has six children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Julius is a teacher by profession and desires to educate his children and also have improved standards of living. He practices farming in order to improve his family income and have food security at home. 

Julius has a dream of educating his children. He is a hard-working man faced with a challenge of under-payment. Julius is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She has a gardening business and sells flowers in the neighborhood. She is happy that she earns by doing what she loves to do. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase more fertilizers, seedlings and compost. In the future, Belen wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers, seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
As well as being a housewife, Yasmeen has 12 years of experience in embroidery, but she is in dire need of finances in order to continue to run her business. The credit crunch that she is currently facing is due to rising inflation and extensive competition. 

The loan would help her to buy a new stitching machine and materials like needles and yarn. With this material her business could become operational again, and would hence provide enough income to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a new stitching machine and materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and is a mother of two children both of whom still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan of KES 5,000 to purchase a fishing net for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem  is a 41-year-old woman living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to save money to provide better living facilities to her children but it seems impossible without a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the motorbike and rickshaw’s body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy the moto rickshaw. She hopes that she will be able to save money to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw.

loans.name: Rangi Tatu Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid 30's, is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been selling motor spare parts for five years now.  She works from 08 am to 09 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Asha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy the fast moving spare parts, and also to restock the out of stock spare parts.  She dreams of making her business grow.

Asha will hold this loan with her loan group, "RANGI TATU",  which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving spare parts and also to restock the out of stock spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university expenses for this semester.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is a 39-year-old widow with five children. Marisol sells vegetables and fruits at the market  and earns 400 PHP each day. She used her income as  capital and for daily family expenses. 

She requests 10,000 PHP  to purchase eggplant, tomatoes, squash, and beans and increase her sales.  Marisol will continue selling good products and services and gain more profits to use for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes, squash, and beans.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel signed up his membership with PMPC and availed himself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital extended to a small time borrower like him. Ariel was able to turn the tide in his favor and makes good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune; he has decided to venture into the hog raising business to raise more income. 

Recently, he requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase several head of pigs and bags of animal feed. In the future, he wishes to owning a small meat shop in the public market and hopes to mount a raise a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase some pigs and bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Located in Miami’s historic Little Havana district, Jesus’ family business, Centro de Artes Graficas Miami, has been a transformative force in his life. 
   
Jesus moved to the United States from Colombia 14 years ago, and started working at a graphic design and print shop shortly afterward. His wife and son, Camilo, also joined the shop, learning all the various aspects of the trade, as well as the business side of things. Eventually, the owners decided sell the company, and Jesus and Camilo took the opportunity to purchase it.   

“The business is my passion, and I like the family atmosphere we have. All my three children and wife contribute in some capacity,” Jesus says.
   
As with many growing businesses, Jesus is facing the challenges of expanding his operations without depleting his finances. 
   
“I’m proud of the results we’ve had in such a short period of time, but we are in need of more modern equipment and increasing our work capital,” he said.
  
The loan Jesus is requesting will go toward buying a color printer, and an additional black-and-white printer to meet the demands of their customers.  
 
Jesus believes that this loan will enable him to be more productive and keep his business competitive. Help him and his family infuse new energy and capital into this venture.

loans.use: to buy a color printer and an additional black-and-white printer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a 42-year-old married man who supports a family of five children.  His wife adds additional income to the family. He has been in motorcycle transport and at the same time he runs a retail shop and this has been in operation for two years, earning himself an income of KES 13,000.  

Pascal was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KE. 40,500 and intends to use this amount to add more stock of sugar, two bales of wheat flour,and add soft drinks and also buy spare wheel for his motorcycle.   

He plans to use the anticipated income to expand his business and educate his children. He hopes to have a bright future and with a lot of success and provide the best quality education to his children.

loans.use: to buy beans, green grams, and maize to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Gulam Abbas

texts.en:
Gulam Abbas is the age of 38, living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is the responsible father of three children. He is a farmer by profession and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops in his land. Mostly he likes to cultivate rice crops. 

In his land area, there is no canal system for watering but the rice crop needs much water for irrigating purposes. So he has to arrange another source for his crops irrigation. Now he has decided to irrigate his land by a tube well system. For this purpose he has to bear some additional amount of expense. Therefore Gulam Abbas has requested a loan from KIVA’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  

He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to use a deep tube well system for crops irrigation

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 43-year-old married man who lives in a rural area with his 12 children. He is a business man who deals in a fish trading business.  He has an additional income from a transportation business and a retail shop. He started this business in 2002.

He works 6 hours per day and started this business because it provides a daily cash flow  and is profitable. He requested this loan to expand his fish business because the product is in demand and provides cash.  He has hopes of becoming rich in the near  future. His clients are traders from surrounding places and community residents.

He faces challenges of limited capital.  He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Msipa

texts.en: Msipa is a mother and businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who teaches life skills to local students. To support herself, Msipa buys and sells call credit for communication networks. With the requested Kiva loan, Msipa intends to purchase an electronic selling point, which will cut transportation costs on delivery. An improvement in her business will help improve her standard of living. She will also be able to pay school fees for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase more airtime for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products in large quantities to increase her profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet in her home.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a businesswoman in her early 50s. She has six children (one son and daughters), two school-aged and the rest are grown up. She is married and has been supporting her family by running two food businesses. 

A restaurant is her first project, where she serves breakfast, lunch and supper foods. Secondly, she has a Grocery, selling spirits, soft drinks and beers. In her restaurant, she also provides catering services. 

She is really an entrepreneurial mother and has been in these businesses since 1982. She runs all her businesses from the same place, as she said it's easier for management. Despite the two food projects, she also raises local chickens at home for sale. Virginia has business helpers and works from 05:00am to10:00pm each working day. She is able to make a very good return per day.

She is now requesting her more than 10th credit cycle via Tujijenge Tanzania. She successfully repaid the previous loans and used them to replenish her grocery with drinks, bought food and cooking ingredients. With her business profit, she covered part of her household expenses and school fees for her children who are still at ordinary level. She is so thankful for Kiva's support, because normally she used a big part of her loan to pay school fees for her children, even for those who have finished. 

With her new credit request, she wants to buy food cooking ingredients; Virginia received a good catering order for someone's function. 

Her desires are to send her children to university and greatly improve her businesses.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for her big catering order.

loans.name: Jose Wilian

texts.es: josé vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda ya que con lo que el obtiene en su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razon solicita dicho credito para poder comprar ladrillos, laminas, cemento, arena, polines y pago de mano de obra para construir una pared y cambiar el techo del lugar que muestra la fotografía, y que pueden vivir seguros y comodos con su familia.
texts.en:
José lives in his own house along with his family. He is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to his home because what he earns from his job is not enough for him to proceed. For this reason, he is requesting this loan so that he can buy bricks, metal sheets, cement, sand, beams, and also pay for labor.

José needs to have a wall built and the roof replaced on his house, as shown in the photograph. This will allow his family to live safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy bricks, metal sheets, cement, sand, beams, and also pay for labor.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. She is mother of 4 children.  Marine is divorced and was face to face with numerous financial hardships. She overcame the great difficulties. 

Her children are  grown and they take care of their lovely mother. Her two sons are  married and they live with their families. Marine’s elder daughter is also married and her youngest daughter lives with her mother and  plans to get married. Marine has a vocational education in cooking and she manages to find work and provide her family with a good living. She worked in the canteens and in the city. She is a cook at a hotel restaurant  in her city.  

Marine’s youngest daughter is going to get married and she wants to organize a beautiful and traditional Armenian wedding party.  She hopes that Kiva lenders will help her financially and the loan  will help her to organize her daughter’s wedding party and make that day nice and unforgettable.

loans.use: to orgnize her daughter’s wedding party.

loans.name: Los Amigos Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Los Amigos lo integran cuatro socios con espíritu de superación, es primer ciclo que trabajan con los financiamiento de la institución, el grupo solidario es coordinado por la señora Leonor, quien tiene la edad de 25 años, casada y madre de un hijo, ofrece en su domicilio el servicio de refresco y helados, este negocio lo impulso hace dos años, con ayuda financiera de su papá, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de frutas como es banano, coco, papaya, nancite, calala, melón, etc., también invertirá en quintal de azúcar y bolsas, todo al por mayor, con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos. Otro de los integrantes es el señor Jaime, quien tiene la edad de 37 años, y se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, además vende nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace diez años, las otras integrantes son las señoras, Martha de 23 años de edad comerciante de ropa típica en los departamentos del occidente del país, Ana de 26 años de edad comerciante de ropa en la región norte del país.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Los Amigos is made up of four members with a strong desire to improve their situation. This is their first loan cycle with the institution. The solidarity group is coordinated by Leonor who is 25 years old, married and the mother of one son. She sells cold drinks and frozen desserts from her house. She started the business two years ago with the financial support of her father. She is asking for a loan so she can buy fruit such as bananas, coconut, papaya, nancite (a small, round, sweet, yellow fruit), passion fruit, melon, etc. She will also buy a sack of sugar and bags, all at wholesale for the purpose of increasing her income.

Another member is Jaime who is 37 years old and has been selling pork products as well as nacatamales (corn cakes steamed in banana leaves) from his house for the past ten years. The other members are Martha, 23, who sells traditonal clothing in the western part of the country; and Ana, 26, who sells clothing in the northern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, and bags.

loans.name: Diego Albenis

texts.es:
Diego un campesino  de 35 años de edad criado en el campo, aprendió todas sus labores gracias a sus padres y hoy por hoy se dedica al cultivo de tomate de árbol.
Diego es un hombre que vela por su padre y madre no tiene familia ni hijos, pero se está enfrentando a un gran problema  y es que por las sequias que hay en el oriente de Antioquia ha perdido sus cultivos dejándolo con un déficit económico difícil de recuperar. 
Al ser una persona del campo no estaba muy enterado de los beneficios que le pueden dar una entidad micro financiera y es que gracias a interactuar este hombre puede recuperar el esplendor de sus tierras, gracias a un crédito que usara para la compra de abonos, riegos, fertilizantes pesticidas para sus cultivos que tanto lo necesitan para soportar estos cambios climáticos. 

Les pedimos que apoyen a este humilde hombre que cuida de su familia que solo tiene sus tierras, que es un agricultor del cual se ven beneficiados miles de personas que inconscientemente disfrutan quizás uno de sus productos en alguna comida
texts.en:
Diego is a 35-year-old farmer who was raised in the fields; he learned his trade thanks to his parents and today he grows tree tomatoes for a living.  

Diego is a man who takes care of his father and mother; he does not have his own family or children, but he is facing a huge problem, which is that droughts east of Antioquia have caused him to lose his crops and have left him with a financial deficit that is difficult to recover. 

Because he is a rural person, he was not very aware of the benefits a microfinancier could provide him with and it was thanks to interacting that this man will be able to recover his fields' splendor thanks to a loan that he will use to buy manures, hoses, fertilizers, and pesticides for his crops, which so badly need these things to withstand these climatic changes. 

We ask that you support his humble man who cares for his family and who only has his fields, as he is a farmer who benefits thousands of people who might eat some of his produce in their food without even knowing it.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain his crops, which were badly affected by drought.  He will buy manures, hoses, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow them improve their home lighting for their children and for making crafts

loans.name: Alexander Fredy

texts.es: Alexander  de 33  años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad de ingeniería ambiental y recursos naturales, está por terminar su carrera  con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación  sigue poniendo de su parte para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Alexander tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen ingeniero. Se siente feliz que Kiva le siga brindando su apoyo ya que es su 4to préstamo, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Alexander   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a  Kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Alexander is 33 years old, single, and has no children; he is a likable student in the Environmental Engineering and Natural Resources Department.  He is about to finish his degree with a lot of hard work and dedication; he keeps doing his part to reach his goals in life.  Alexander's goal is to finish his studies successfully and to be a great engineer.  He is happy that Kiva is still supporting him, as this is his fourth loan.  He will use this loan to pay his university housing fees and to buy school supplies that he needs.  Alexander is very thankful for the help he has received and he finishes by expressing his great desire to achieve the goals he has set.  He thanks Kiva for the opportunity it has offered him.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Marichu
