She dreams of having a big store, being a businesswoman, establishing herself, and giving her son the best, and with God's help, providing him with the eduction he will certainly need to become a professional one day.

loans.use: to buy more products for her business; she will buy sugar, oil, beans, salt, and rice, among other staple products

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a 38-year-old, married woman with four school-going children, living in Kasese, Uganda . 

She has been a food vendor in the market for five years and gets additional income from farming. She is a hard-working woman, despite limited capital. Zubeda appreciates the services rendered to her since she managed to increase her income and pay the previous loan.

Zubeda needs a loan to buy bananas and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Delcy Maria

texts.es:
Delcy hace 12 años inicio con su cafetería como una solución a los problemas económicos que atravesaba su familia en el momento, su tenacidad y espíritu emprendedor y de salir adelante la llevo a comercializar sus productos en un colegio del sector de chinu, una localidad muy pobre pero ella espera que esa generación sea el futuro del pueblo y que la recuerden como la señora que les vendía productos en el colegio. 
Solicita un crédito para comprar insumos en grandes cantidades y poder dejarles a los niños las comidas un poco más económicas concientizándose de la dura situación económica de las familias.
texts.en:
Delcy started her canteen 12 years ago as a solution to the financial problems her family was going through at that time. Her tenacity and enterprising spirit, with her determination to make a living, led her to sell her products in a school in the Chinu sector. This is a very poor locality, but she hopes that this generation will be the community’s future, and that they will remember her as the lady who sold food in their school. 

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies in bulk quantities so she can sell her food to the students at a cheaper price, because she understands the difficult economic situation the families face.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk quantities so she can sell her food to the students at a cheaper price, because the area is extremely poor.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 29-year-old married woman; she is living along with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been working as a laborer in a small firm for daily wages. His income is very low; therefore he decided to increase the source of income in the form of an electrician shop. He has been troubleshooting electrical components, such as water pumps, fans, and other electrical accessories. Now he has become very expert in his profession and can hold the full affairs of an electrician’s shop.
 
Zahida wants to buy initial stock of electrical goods to set up the newly opened electric shop for her husband. This is the reason she contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can be able to buy initial stock such as sockets, bulbs, tube lights, switches, and electrical goods.

Zahida hopes the lenders of Kiva will take a warm participation to help her. She is very thankful to Kiva, Kiva's lenders, and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy initial stock such as sockets, bulbs, tube lights, switches, and electrical goods.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen, who was born in 1986 in Dong Anh district, has two children. Both of her children are still young and studying at kindergarten. Yen and her husband sell firewood to earn a living. They can earn VND 8,000,000 per month from this job. 

Yen has been a participant in SEDA’s program since 2013. She repaid her previous loan of VND 5,014,000 and she is now requesting her second loan, in the amount of VND 7,194,000, to expand her firewood store. 

She wishes she could save enough money to provide a better education for her children and get more income to improve the living standard of her family. The other members of Yen’s Group are as follows: 

Thanh, a mother of three, makes bamboo brooms for a living. She is requesting a loan of VND 11,990,000 to purchase materials to make bamboo brooms. 

Soa, a mother of two, is 51 years old. She makes bamboo brooms. She wants to borrow VND 11,118,000 to purchase materials to make bamboo brooms. 

Thanh, a mother of two, is 37 years old. She is applying a loan of VND 11,118,000 to raise pigs. 

Thinh, a mother of two, is 48 years old. She would like to borrow VND 7,194,000 to sell gas. 

Hai, a mother of two, is 49 years old. She wants to borrow VND 7,194,000 to sell leaves to make medicine. 

Lieu, a mother of three, is 54 years old. She is requesting a loan of VND 5,014,000 to sell beverages.

loans.use: to expand her firewood store.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 38-years-old and married with seven children, six of whom attend school.They live in Kasese, Uganda.  For ten years, Julius  has been running a retail shop and also riding a motorcycle; thus, enabling him to pay school fees for his children and also sustain the family. His major challenges are price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high fuel prices.  However, he has a dream of educating his children.  Julius needs the loan to buy cassava flour, millet flour, maize flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, millet flour, maize flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is 58-years-old and happily married to her husband, Emilio, who works as a building administrator. She and her husband are helping each other with working so they can give their family a good future.

Adelaida owns a computer shop. The computers are rented for Php 20.00 per hour. Still, some families don’t have their own computers so they go to computer shops to encode and print documents. Others rent to connect with their loved ones abroad and others, specially the children and the youth, rent to play games. Normally, computer shops open at 8am and close at 7pm. Her regular customers are the children and youth of their community. She earns Php 500.00 a day.

Just as any other business owner, she is also hoping that her shop will continue to expand and have more customers and branches. She dreams of good health and longer life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance and additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik lives in Stepanavan city, of the Lori region. He is married and he lives with his wife, who is unemployed, and they have a son. He works at the Ministry of Internal Affairs. Valerik graduated Yerevan State Economical University and it is already 41 years that he has worked as a pedagogue. 

Now, he works at the State Agricultural College in Stepanavan city. Here he is a lecturer and also the head of the department of distance learning. He teaches management and accounting to his students. At his house, he also gives private courses of mathematics, preparing the pupils for entrance examinations. 

Valerik says that during his pedagogical activities, he greatly needs a computer which will help him to get prepared for his management lectures and he also needs to buy professional literature since innovations are a lot and he has a lack of that.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married and has four school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Tharwa

texts.en:
Tharwa is a 46-year-old hardworking woman. After her husband retired from the military, they had to open a small business from where they could support themselves besides the retirement salary. So, she opened a small market to sell food and cleaning products to the neighborhood.

Now, Tharwa is applying for a loan to add more food products to her market to cover most of the neighborhood’s needs.

loans.use: to add more food products to her market.

loans.name: Teresa Aracely

texts.es:
Tereza de 25 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar como agente policial, juntos han procreado dos hijos, uno de ellos está estudiando primer grado en la escuela y el otro aún no estudia por su edad.


Tereza se dedica a los oficios de su hogar, cuidando sus pequeños hijos, sus ingresos son producto de remesas que le envían sus familiares, por la edad de sus niños no ha podido salir a la ciudad a trabajar porque  no tiene quien se los cuide y anteriormente trabaja en una tienda de productos básicos.


Ella necesita el crédito para cancelar un dinero que debe a un familiar.


Su sueño es poner un  negocio de productos básicos y con ello mejorar sus ingresos, también pretende seguir estudiando para tener más oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Teresa is 25 years old, is married, and her husband works as a police officer. Together, they have had two children; one of them is studying in first grade in the school, and the other still doesn’t attend school because of his age. 

Teresa dedicates herself to housework, taking care of her small children. Her income is from remittances that her relatives send her. Because of her children’s ages, she has not been able to go to the city to work, because she doesn’t have anyone who can look after the children. Previously, she worked in a store that sold everyday products.

She needs a loan to repay some money that she owes a relative. Her dream is to have a business selling everyday products, and, with this, to improve her income. She also hopes to continue studying to have more job opportunities.

loans.use: to repay some money that she owes to a relative.

loans.name: Farqana

texts.en:
Farqana is 44 years old, married, with a daughter and a son. She is a very caring mother and does everything for her family. Her husband is a laborer and earns some money in order to cover demands. But, the main income is gardening. 

Farqana is a gardener. She raises and sells seasonal fruits. She has been working as a gardener for ten years and has good skills. She sells her harvest at the local bazaar in a small grocery. She knows that fruits are always in high demand. Her monthly income is AZN 300 and it isn’t enough to cover the family's needs.

Farqana has a small land to raise her harvest and productivity is low. She applied for an AZN 1,500 loan in order to enlarge the land and raise more fruits. This will allow her to provide her family with a good life and good income.

loans.use: to enlarge the land and raise more fruits.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Pyapy Mbarete está en su tercer  ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde además forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edi.
Ella está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, y comenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, de manera a que por medio de este trabajo puede ayudar a su familia. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas y de estación, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Pyapy Mbarete" communal bank is in their third cycle with the Woman's Committee program. They are also part of the Eradicate Poverty program.

One of the members is Edi. She is participating in the eradicate poverty survey, and she comments that she works selling fruit and vegetables. By doing this she is able to help her family. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fresh seasonal fruit and vegetables so she can continue with her sales, striving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork rinds, fried pork, sausage, pork, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 44 year old man married to Lilian who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three chidren. 

Peter has been a carpenter for a period of two years earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Peter is now servicing his 2nd loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy timber, plywood and nails to add to his current stock.  

Peter plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy timber and nails to increase his stock.

loans.name: Xiomara Yamileth

texts.es: Xiomara de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 1 año y un varón de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida gracias a la elaboración y venta de quesadillas de arroz, la cual realiza en su vivienda. Xiomara desea mejorar su negocio de elaboración y venta de quesadillas, por lo que desea comprar un horno a gas y reparar el horno artesanal para vender por mayor y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: compra de horno a gas y materiales para reparación de horno artesanal. Agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: Xiomara is 25 years old, and she lives in her own house with her partner and their two children—a 1-year-old daughter and a 5-year-old son. She is a woman who has earned for a long time by making and selling “quesadillas de arroz” (a type of sweet bread), an activity she pursues in her house. Xiomara wants to improve her business of making and selling the bread, so she wants to buy a gas oven and to repair her traditional oven so that she can sell wholesale. It is because of this that she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: buying a gas oven and in buying materials to repair her traditional oven. She is thankful for the support she has received in the past to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy a gas oven and materials to repair her traditional oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her farm.

loans.name: Nrrajuama Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Nrrajuama” está integrado por mujeres muy trabajadoras y con iniciativa; llevan ya varios años solicitando crédito a VisionFund México para mejorar sus negocios. El nombre del grupo está en su lengua materna y significa significa "lugar donde están".

Doña Bernarda tiene 64 años de edad, está casada con el señor Antonio y juntos formaron una familia con 8 hijos. A pesar de su edad y de que ya ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella, aún trabaja vendiendo vasos de licuadora para cubrir los gastos del hogar y porque su esposo ya es grande y no le gustaría que se enfermara por las preocupaciones económicas. Bernarda explica que inició su negocio hace 20 años pues quería ayudar con los gastos de sus hijos, entonces aprovechaba para vender en los tianguis de su comunidad y a ofrecer la mercancía de casa en casa para obtener más ganancias. Actualmente, ella prefiere seguir trabajando sin tener un puesto fijo, pues prefiere llegar hasta donde se encuentran sus clientes. Ella necesita volver a invertir en más vasos de licuadora para continuar con la actividad.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son: Ma. de Carmen y Ana Ma. quienes invertirán en banderas mexicanas; Adelaida, en artículos de papelería; Ma. Alberta, en su tienda de abarrotes; Bernarda, en vasos de licuadora; Angélica, en jarciaría y Graciela, en calcetines.

*En la imagen: la señora Bernarda es la primera del lado derecho y viste un suéter gris. La foto fue tomada en la plazoleta de los arcos del municipio de las integrantes. Se pueden apreciar la iglesia y el quiosco.
texts.en:
The "Nrrajuama" group is made up of hardworking women with a lot of initiative.  They have received loans to improve their business from VisionFund Mexico for many years.  The name of the group is in their native tongue and it means "the place where they are".  

Bernarda is 64 years old, she is married to Antonio, and together they have eight children.  Despite her age and the fact that none of her children are dependent on her, she still works selling blender cups to cover her household expenses since her husband is older and she would not want him to get sick worrying about their finances.  Bernarda explains that she started her business 20 years ago because she wanted to help with her children's expenses.  Therefore, she took advantage of the opportunity to sell in her local flea markets as well as door-to-door, in order to increase her earnings.  She prefers to work without a fixed location because she likes to go to where her customers are.  She is in need of purchasing more blender cups to continue with her business.

The other members of the group are: Maria de Carmen and Ana Maria who will purchase Mexican flags, Adelaida who will purchase paper goods, Maria Alberta who will invest in her grocery store, Bernarda who will purchase blender cups, Angelica who will purchase household goods, and Graciela who will purchase socks.  

In the photograph, Bernarda is the first one on the left and is wearing a grey sweater.  The picture was taken in the Los Arcos plaza of their town.  The church and the gazebo cane seen int he picture.

loans.use: purchase blender cups.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Restic

texts.en:
Restic is a 36-year-old hardworking woman married to Silvance who adds additional income to support their family and are blessed with two children.  Restic has been operating a plastic sales business for a period of four years earning her an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Restic was introduced to VisionFund Kenya and is now servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 and intends to use this entire amount to buy plastic basins, buckets, jugs, plates and cups to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Restic plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy basins, buckets, jugs, plates and cups to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a farmer in Tala and has been in the business for 15 years now. She is 50 years old, married and, together with her spouse, they have been blessed with six children. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family.

Margaret will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She will also buy cattle feed for her cows. She will use the anticipated profits to buy another cow.

This is Margaret's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully paid her previous loans. Her future hope is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and cattle feed.

loans.name: Hector Alonso

texts.es:
Héctor un hombre casero, criado bajo los excelentes valores del campo donde el trabajo y la humildad prevalecen en la mente de los campesinos quienes proporciona el alimento que comúnmente consumen las personas en su hogar. 
Héctor es un criador de cerdos pero valora la posibilidad de comenzar con un criadero de pollos razón por la cual solicita un crédito para comprar pollos y su cuido puesto que ya tiene el corral construido para albergarlos. 
Su gran necesidad pasa por su familia tiene una hija de 7 meses de edad y es muy consciente de que hoy en día es muy difícil de conseguir los recursos y solo tiene su negocio que espera sacar adelante para evitar quedarse en la calle con su pareja y su hija de 7 meses de edad.
texts.en:
Héctor is a home-loving man who was raised with the excellent values of the fields, where work and humility prevail in the minds of farmers who provide food commonly consumed by people in their homes.

Héctor is a pig farmer however he also appreciates the opportunity to start a poultry farm. This is the reason that he is requesting a loan to buy chickens and the trappings since he has already constructed a pen to house them.

His great need involves his family. He has a 7-month old daughter and is very aware that it is very difficult today to obtain resources. He has only his business that he hopes will succeed so that he will not end up in the street with his partner and their 7-month old daughter.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed to start raising poultry to sell.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a 40-year-old, illiterate woman. She is a mother of three children. Her husband works, selling chicken. On the other hand, Khitam is working from her house, making traditional Arabic bread, 'Shrak,' and selling it to the neighbors and some food stores. 

Khitam is applying for a loan to buy more ingredients to make bread and to enhance her work space.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is aged 34 years old and married with one child living in Kasese-Uganda. He is a health worker who needs a loan faciliy to buy cement, bricks and sand to construct his residential house. He has been in health services for ten years and likes his profession, saving people's lives. Samson also practices farming to get additional income. 

He is a hard working person faced with a challenge of late payments.

Samson has a dream of having an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Elena es madre soltera de 38 años de edad, tiene una hija de 10 maños que asiste a la escuela, Elena se dedica a la crianza de animales y  a la agricultura en pequeña cantidad, Elena necesita el crédito para comprar chanchos y tenerlos en cancheras, algunos los cría engorda y les vende y también comprar chancas grandes para reproductoras ya que dice que este es un buen negocio y que le permite darle lo necesario a su hija, la mayor aspiración de Elena es que mejoren sus ingresos  mediante su negocio y velar siempre por .el bienestar de sus hija
texts.en: Elena is a single mother, who is 38 years old. She has a 10-year-old daughter who attends school. Elena dedicates herself to raising animals and to agriculture in small quantities. She needs a loan to buy pigs and to have then in experienced hands. Some of the pigs she raises will fatten, and she will sell them. She will also buy large female pigs so they can breed, since she says that this is a good business and that it allows her to give her daughter what she needs. Her biggest aspiration is to improve her income through her business and to keep working for the wellbeing of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Daniz

texts.en:
Daniz is 23 years old. He is a bachelor and lives with his parents. He raises fruits and vegetables and supplies them to groceries at local bazaars. His monthly income is AZN 300 and he gained good skills during three years. 

Daniz takes care of flora and raises them properly. Daniz works very hard in order to provide for his family and his father helps him. He supplies small batches to local bazaars and restaurants.

Gardening is the only source of income, but Daniz has a problem with water. He applied for an AZN 900 loan in order to repair water pipes and be able to properly water his garden.

loans.use: to repair water pipes and be able to properly water his garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase two pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a widow with four children, three of whom go to school. They live in Kasese, Uganda. Mary has a retail business selling general merchandise. She also does farming for additional income. However, she is faced with a challenge of debtors and inadequate capital. Mary is a hardworking woman. She appreciates the services being offered by Hofokam, as she has reaped the benefits from them. She hopes to expand her business and educate her children. Mary is in need of money to buy millet flour, soap, salt, books, cassava flour, sugar, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To buy millet flour, soap, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Integrantes De La Manzana Group

texts.es:
“Soy mamá de cuatro hijos siempre me he preocupado por el bienestar de mis niños y de alguna manera necesitaba ayudar con los gastos del hogar” comenta Doña Catalina de 45 años de edad. Ella se casó con el señor Andrés hace 26 años y actualmente, sólo uno de sus hijos depende de ellos.

Desde hace más de 22 años, doña Catalina se ha dedicado a vender bonetería y por coincidencia, la familia de Andrés también comercializaba los mismos productos pero llegaban a otros mercados y así ella también comenzó a salir a otras comunidades e incluso estados del país, pues sabía que era la manera de ayudar aún más a su esposo. Más tarde, Catalina conoció a VisionFund México y sus préstamos los invierte en mercancía para su propio puesto, ya que es independiente del de su marido. Catalina comenta que su gran meta es ayudar a su hija que está por terminar una carrera en enfermería. 

Así como Doña Catalina, los demás integrantes del grupo también quieren cumplir sus sueños y para eso necesitan hacer crecer sus negocios: Catalina e Itzayana invertirán en bonetería (calcetines, calcetas); Javier, en plásticos y bonetería y Oscar, en vasos de jarcería.
texts.en:
Catalina, 45, states that as a mother of four children, she has been preoccupied by the wellbeing of her children, and she needed to find some way of helping with the household expenses.  She married Andrés 26 years ago, and at the moment, only one of their children depends on them.  Over 22 years ago, Catalina started working selling hosiery, and coincidentally, Andrés's family also sold these products at other markets.  She started going out to sell in different communities as well as states around the country because she knew this was the way to help her husband. 

Later on, Catalina found out about VisionFund Mexico and started using their loans to invest in merchandise for her own store which is separate from her husband's.  Catalina states that her biggest goal is to help her daughter who is about to finish her nursing degree.  Like Catalina, the other members of the group also want to achieve their dreams, which is why they need to grow their businesses.  Catalina and Itzayana will invest in hosiery (socks, stocking), Javier will purchase plastic goods and hosiery, and Oscar will purchase glasses.

loans.use: purchase socks and stockings.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a single man with children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop of general merchandise. He also does farming and owns a motorcycle, where he gets additional income. He started the business in order to cater to his parents and to earn a living. Richard is a hard-working man, faced with challenges of limited capital and bad weather.

Richard wants money to buy land in order to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 53-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her children like her a lot due to her caring. Currently, Allah Rakhi owns a dairy farm at her home, and has done so since 1998. She produces milk with the help of her sons. She is growing old and does not have enough energy to perform her tasks as she used to do at a young age. 

A few days ago, one of her cattle was stolen due to lack of security, and there is not proper shelter for her cattle. This needs to be improved. She wants to buy a cow and maintain a cowshed, but she has insufficient savings. Therefore, Allah Rakhi requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she could overcome these deficiencies and carry on her business smoothly. 

From the profit amount, Allah Rakhi will ensure the security of her cattle and build a shelter for them so that she can avoid theft in the future. 

Allah Rakhi is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and build a cowshed for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Jamilah

texts.en:
Jamilah is a 38-year-old, conservative woman. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

After her husband retired from the military, they decided to make a small business at home to have another income for the family of five members. Jamilah sells blankets and bed covers at their house, while her husband is the one who brings her the products from the distributor. 

Now that families are preparing for winter season, Jamilah is applying for a loan to increase the quantity she has, to be able to cover the neighborhood’s demand.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of blankets to sell.

loans.name: Florentín Santos

texts.es:
Florentín tiene 36 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, de él dependen únicamente su pareja e hijos.

Florentín se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado desde hace diez años, ya que se siente bien trabajando en este rubro y es un negocio que le genera los ingresos económicos necesarios para su hogar.

Él necesita mucho este crédito para comprar dos terneros para cuidarlos y luego venderlos, esto le ayudará a poder seguir con su negocio y seguir generando ingresos económicos para su hogar y mejor su calidad de vida y de su familia.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
Florentín is 36 years old, is married, and has two children. His wife is dedicated to household tasks. His children depend on him alone.

Florentín has bought and sold livestock for ten years, since he feels good working in this role and since it is a business that earns him the income he needs for his household.

He needs this loan very much to buy two calves to take care of and, after that, to sell them. This will help him to be able to continue with his business, to continue earning income for his household, and to improve the quality of his and his family’s life. 

His dream is that his children become professionals and good people.

loans.use: to buy two calves to take care of and, afterward, to sell them.

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es:
José de 21 años de edad,  no tuvo ningún tipo de nivel académico, ahora está acompañado y tiene una hija de seis meses de edad, su pareja trabaja en un restaurante para ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar.

José se dedica a la albañilería, construye casas, pone pisos entre otras cosas, tiene dos años de dedicarse a este trabajo pues la situación económica es difícil y por lo tanto él tiene que ver todos los medios posibles para sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales para reparar su casa como cemento, arena, cerámicas, techos etc.

Su sueño es que su familia tenga buena vivienda y darle lo mejor a su hija recién nacida.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old, and he doesn’t have any academic degrees. He is married and has a six-month-old daughter. His wife works in a restaurant to help with the household expenses.

José is in construction. He builds houses and puts in floors, among other things. He has spent two years working in this profession. His financial situation is difficult, so he has to look for every possible opportunity to take his family forward.

The loan he needs is to buy materials to repair his house, including cement, sand, clay, roofs, etc.

His dream is for his family to have a nice home and to give the best to his newborn daughter.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his house, including cement, sand, clay, roofs, etc.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia and she owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for six years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income and to provide for her everyday needs.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She also has a canteen business and she will use a portion of the loan for the raw ingredients and supplies needed in the canteen business 

In the future, Olivia wants to give her family a better life and she also wants to improve and increase her sales from her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Arístides Alexander

texts.es:
Arístides de 18 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta Bachillerato, está soltero y todavía  no tiene hijos, con él viven sus padres y sus hermanos.


Arístides se dedica a sembrar granos básicos como maíz y frijol, actualmente está trabajando como auxiliar de albañilería. A trabajar como jornalero se lo enseñaron sus padres y sus tíos, porque ellos siempre han trabajado en esta área, cuenta que él siempre iba a los terrenos donde trabajaba su padre a dejarle los alimentos y se quedaba con él a trabajar. El lugar donde trabaja le queda a 15 minutos de su casa y se transporta a pie y lo hace de 6 A.M. a 12 M.D.


Él solicita el crédito para ayudar a su padre a mejorar su vivienda, comprará bloques, arena y también pagará la mano de obra. El crédito mejorará su condición de vida porque podrán vivir más cómodos con sus hermanos y sus padres.

Su sueño es seguir estudiando en la universidad  para ser profesional, y en un futuro apoyar a sus padres en lo que sea necesario, es decir en los gastos del hogar para que puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Arístides, 18, is a high school graduate, single and childless.  He lives with his parents and his siblings.  Arístides works planting basic grains like corn and beans.  He is currently working as a mason's assistant.  His parents and uncles taught him how to work as a day laborer because they also work in this field, and he used to go to the fields where his father worked to bring him food, and he would stay with him while he worked.  The place where he works is 15 minutes away from their home and he walks their.  He works from 6am to noon.

He is seeking a loan to help his father repair their home by purchasing blocks, sand and paying for labor.  The loan will help their living conditions because his siblings and parents will be able to live more comfortably.  His dream is to attend college so that he can be a professional and be able to support his parents in the future with their household expenses.

loans.use: help his dad to repair their home by purchasing blocks, sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, ella es soltera pues se separó de su esposo, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales 1  vive con ella y estudia 3er grado, los otros tres viven con el papá.
 
Dinora se dedica al comercio de ropa y ayuda a su mamá a vender pescado seco de la cual se reparten las ganancias, ella desde que era adolescente trabajaba vendiendo, por su misma situación económica, un día decidió realizar ventas ambulantes, salía a vender en los buses y al mercado productos como agua, jugos y sodas, fue así como adquirió experiencias en esta área y decidió seguir siempre en el negocio. El lugar donde ella sale a vender la ropa  le queda a tres km de distancia y vende de casa en casa.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para abastecer su pequeño negocio, así podrá ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Ella sueña con que su negocio crezca y contratar a otra persona que le ayude, además espera apoyar a sus hijos en lo que sea necesario.
texts.en:
Dinora is 31 years old and has a sixth grade education.  She is single, having divorced her husband, and has four children.  One of her children lives with her and is in third grade.  The other three live with their father.  Dinora works selling clothing and helps her mother to sell dried fish, splitting the profits.  She has worked selling products since she was a teenager.  Given her financial situation, she decided one day to start selling in the streets.  She would go out to sell products like water, juices and sodas on buses and in the market.  By doing this, she gained experience in this field, and decided to continue with this business.  The place that she goes to sell her clothing is three kilometers away, and she sells door-to-door.

She is in need of this loan to purchase more clothing for women, men and children to stock her store and offer better service to her customers.  She dreams of growing her business and hiring another person to help her.  She also hopes to support her children in anything that they need.

loans.use: purchase more clothing for women, men and children to stock her store.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, age 26 years, is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, Mwanamisi has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, Mwanamisi wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Kyabugimbi Twetungure Group

texts.en: Betty, a member of the group, is thankful for the financial support that the Kiva lenders though UGAFODE have rendered them. They had been tossed up and down in all areas for not having collateral but thanks to the Kiva lenders, they are able to acquire loans. Betty will use the loan to pay tuition for her daughter in high school. She is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Ilcia Aridai

texts.es:
Ilcia de 24 años de edad, es una joven luchadora que desde muy pequeña se crió con su tío ya que sus padres emigraron al extranjero para poder darle un futuro mejor, actualmente está cursando  el  2° año de su carrera universitaria en Administración de empresas, está soltera y no tiene hijos.

Con mucho esfuerzo y con ayuda de sus padres, Ilcia puso su propio negocio de venta de ropa  para personas de todas  las edades, tanto para hombres como para mujeres y niños recién nacidos, ya tiene aproximadamente 2 años de tener este negocio y hasta la fecha le ha dado muy buenos frutos,  ella ha  tomado experiencia en lo que hace y se siente capaz de poder agrandar un poco más su negocio.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y venderla en su negocio.

Su sueño más grande es disponer de un local que esté en un lugar estratégico para tener buena demanda de sus productos, además esta dentro de sus planes continuar con sus estudios para lograr culminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ilcia is 24 years old. She is a persevering young woman, who from a young age was raised by her uncle since her parents emigrated to another county to be able to give her a better future. At present, she is in her second year of her university degree, studying business administration. She is single and doesn’t have any children.

With a lot of effort and with the help of her parents, Ilcia was able to start her own business selling clothes for people of all ages and for men, women, and babies. She has already had this business for two years, and so far, it has gone very well for her. She has experience in this work and feels capable of growing her business little by little.

She needs the loan to buy more clothes for women, men, and children and to sell the clothing through her business.

Her biggest dream is to have a store that is in a strategic location so that she has a good demand for her products. She is also pursuing her plans to continue with her education to succeed in finishing her degree.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for women, men, and children and to sell the clothing through her business.

loans.name: Ruth Nohemy

texts.es:
Ruth es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, no culminó sus estudios de bachillerato debido a que quedó embarazada y eso le impidió continuar, su pareja trabaja en una peluquería y ambos con esfuerzo luchan para salir adelante con su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad.

Ruth se dedica a los oficios domésticos, además vende tamales, pan y  productos como cremas para la piel y perfumes. La venta de tamales la realiza desde que salió embarazada y su esposo es quien le ayuda siempre que puede.
Ella necesita el crédito para comprar muebles que necesita en su casa y de esta forma tener mas comodidad para ella y su familia.
Su gran sueño es poder tener un hogar  de adobe o de bloque, ya que donde ahora vive es de bahareque,  además sueña con darle a su hijo el apoyo emocional y orientación que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Ruth is an enterprising young woman who is 20 years old. She did not finish her high school studies because she became pregnant and was unable to continue. Her partner works in a hair salon and both are struggling to get ahead with their small 3-year old son.

Ruth is dedicated to her household duties and, in addition, sells tamales, bread and products, such as skin creams and perfume. She has been selling tamales since she became pregnant and her husband always helps her whenever he can.

She needs the loan to purchase furniture that she needs for their house so that she and her family can be more comfortable.

Her great dream is to have an adobe or cinder block house since the one they live in now is made of mud. She dreams as well of giving her son the emotional support and guidance that she never had.

loans.use: to purchase furniture she needs for her house so that she and her family can be more comfortable.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 53 years old and a single mother of three children. She sells beauty products and clothes and has been in the business for five years. 

She will be using this loan to buy more beauty products to sell. These include body lotions and sprays as well as body and hair cream. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 40 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with seven children. She does farming in Tala town where she grows vegetables, maize and beans to sell. She has been in this business for five years now and it has been profitable.

She will use the loan to pay school fees for her child who is in university. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund from Kenya and she paid back her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her farming business, be successful and educate her children as well keep her family in good health.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en:
Basima is a 47-year-old married lady. She is helping her family by adding another source of income from selling women’s clothes, specifically abayas. 

She is now applying for a loan to bring more styles of abaya, and more colors to have variety in what she sells.

loans.use: to bring more styles of abaya to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 78 años de edad, sus hijos ya no viven con él pues ya son mayores de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos.
Pedro trabaja en la agricultura, él siembra maíz, frijoles y maicillo, aprendió el trabajo gracias a sus padres y a sus hermanos quienes le mostraron el oficio en los terrenos que tenían. Actualmente siembra 3 hectárea de maíz, media hectárea de frijoles, y media de maicillo, el trabajo lo hace con el apoyo de su hijo y de mozos a quienes les paga por sus labores, Pedro tiene que madrugar a las cinco de la mañana donde tiene que caminar por mas de treinta minutos por las colinas para llegar donde siembra.

Él necesita en crédito para comprar una vaca, quiere aprovechar que tiene donde cuidarla y tiene residuos de cosecha para alimentarla en el verano lo que le permitirá producir mas leche para el consumo y para vender en la comunidad. Además comprará insumos agrícolas.
Él sueña con comprar mas vacas para aumentar su hato de ganado y producir mas leche para vender y producir sus derivados.
texts.en:
Pedro is 78 years old. His children no longer live with him, since they are adults. His wife is dedicated to household tasks and to raising chickens and pigs.

Pedro works in agriculture. He grows corn, beans, and sorghum. He learned the work thanks to his parents and siblings, who showed him the trade on the land they had. At present, he grows 3 hectares of corn, half a hectare of beans, and half a hectare of sorghum. He works with the support of his son and some workhands, who he pays for their work. Pedro has to wake up at 5 in the morning, at which point he has to walk for more than 30 minutes through hills to get to the place where he grows. 

He needs a loan to buy a cow. He wants to take advantage of the fact that he has a place to take care of a cow and that he has extra food from the harvest to feed a cow. In the summer, the investment will allow him to produce more milk for consuming and for selling in the community. He will also buy agricultural supplies.

He dreams of buying more cows to grow his cattle herd and to produce more milk to sell and to produce its by-products.

loans.use: to buy a cow and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Boresha Maisha Group

texts.en:
Mathias is a father of three children They are all boys and they are still young. He is 28 years old and takes care of his family accompanied by his wife.  Mathias has been running a grocery for four years now and enjoys a good monthly profit from his business. Usually he opens his grocery at 8:00 am and close at 10:00 pm. Mathias's grocery sells soft drinks, spirits and beers.

This is his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous credit to buy crates of beer and soda. Mathias paid back in full his loan and earned a good profit, which help him to grow his business. Now he expect to manage a wholesale business selling drinks. 

Mathias will invest his loan to buy a variety of drinks for his grocery. He and his group are so grateful and thankful with everyone who will find a way to support his group.

loans.use: to buy variety of drinks for his grocery

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vuqar is a 35-year-old married man. He has two sons and his wife is a housekeeper. He is a farmer and raises seasonal vegetables and crops. Then he sells his harvest to different food suppliers. He has worked in this business for 10 years but his income is only 300 AZN and it doesn’t cover the family’s needs.

The region where Vuqar lives sometimes has a lack of water and this is harmful for gardens and plants. Vuqar grows his harvest properly but the water problem makes a barrier for good productivity.

Vuqar needs money in order to cover his family’s needs. He wants to increase his income and be able to provide his sons a good education and bright future. He applied for a 600 AZN loan because he plans to build a water pipeline for his plants and garden. This will increase the productivity and income of the family.

loans.use: to build a water pipeline for his plants and garden.

loans.name: Apolinnaire

texts.en:
Apolinaire is 33 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 4, 1 of them goes to school. 

He has been farming for 20 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to buy land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for potatoes.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment.

She is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

Mwaka really appreciates the previous loan granted to her.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as tomatoes and oranges, among other staples.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy was made  happy by the increase in income she has, after adding the sale of  food products at her convenience store.

She is now applying for another loan to add candies and celebration chocolate to sell for the upcoming celebration of Adha Eid, an Islamic holiday.

loans.use: to add candies and celebration chocolate to sell

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, con esfuerzo de sus padres logró estudiar hasta noveno grado, está casado y es padre de dos hijos menores de edad, su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos y está a cargo de  la granja de pollos de engorde que tienen en el hogar.

Desde la edad de 12 años, José se ha dedica a la crianza de especies menores, pero actualmente actualmente trabaja en una ferretería de lunes a sábados, desde la mañana hasta las cinco de tarde. La granja la cuida su esposa mientras él trabaja, los pollos los engordan y los venden cuando ya están lo suficientemente grandes.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar 200 pollos de engorde, comprará concentrados y vacunas para los mismos, además desea hacer arreglos en la granja.
 
Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una vivienda donde pueda mantener su granja ya que por el momento rentan.
texts.en:
Jose, 32, with the effort of his parents managed to study up to the ninth grade.  He is married and is the father of two minor children.  His wife works doing domestic duties and is in charge of the fattening chicken farm that they have in the home.
Since he was 12, Jose has made a living raising small animals, but nowadays he works in a hardware store Monday through Saturday from the morning until 5:00 p.m. His wife takes care of the farm while he works.  She fattens the chickens and sells them when they are sufficiently large.
He needs the loan to buy 200 chickens for fattening.  He will buy chicken feed and vaccines for them.  In addition, he would like to make repairs to the farm.
His dream is to buy a piece of land in order to construct a residence where he can keep his farm since at the moment they rent.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens for fattening.  He will also buy chicken feed and vaccines for them.  In addition, he wishes to make repairs to the farm.

loans.name: José Edwin

texts.es:
José tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está acompañado  y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, José aún vive en casa de sus padres.

José se dedica a la agricultura, además vende los granos básicos que él mismo produce,  se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 15 años, el lugar donde trabaja está cerca de su casa por lo tanto se va a pie y trabaja 6 horas diarias.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, semillas, fertilizantes, foliares y herbicidas para fertilizar el maíz que ya sembró. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando en la agricultura ya que muchas personas que se dedicaban a esta área en su comunidad ya no lo hacen y desea seguir apoyando a este rubro.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old and has studied until sixth grade of primary school. He is married, and his wife is dedicated to household tasks. He has two young children. José still lives in his parents’ house.

José works in agriculture. He also sells basic grains that he himself produces. He has done this work for 15 years. The place where he works is near his house, so he goes to work by walking and works for 6 hours daily.

He needs the loan to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, leaves, and herbicides to fertilize the corn that he has already planted. 

His dreams are to continue working in agriculture, since many people in his community that worked in agriculture before, don’t do it anymore. He wants to continue supporting this profession.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, leaves, and herbicides to fertilize the corn he has already planted.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y tiene una hija, su esposa solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José se dedica a la venta de ropa y también a la venta de pollo frito, consiguió este trabajo por un amigo suyo, y tiene que trasladarse todos los días s los lugares donde vende. 

El crédito lo necesita  para comprar más ropa para vender.

Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que actualmente vive en casa de su madre.
texts.en:
Jose, 24, studied through secondary school.  He is married and has a daughter.  His wife only does the domestic duties.
Jose makes a living in clothing sales and also in fried chicken sales.  He got this job from a friend of his and he has to get himself to the places where he sells every day.
He needs the loan in order to buy more clothing to sell.
His dream is to have his own house since these days he lives with his mother.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Damian

texts.en:
Damian is a previous customer. He is aged 41 years old and married with 6 children. He is predominantly a rural farmer specializing in coffee growing and banana planting. 

Damian decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan. He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX. He has a challenge of little income from his agriculture and so wants to borrow money to buy manure especially grass cowdung. He hopes to get enough output and educate his children. He is sure his yields will improve bringing an increase in his income. 

He is hard working and focused.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a special needs client from Iraq. He is 50 year old, married, and has three children. 

Mohamad wants to start a new business which is a stationery shop. He worked for several years in this field as a partner with his neighbor but now he wants to open his own store. He wants to sell small gifts and provide photocopying services in addition to selling stationery. 

Mohamad is requesting a loan of $2,034 to buy all needed assets to start his business. He is aiming to run his business perfectly and expand it in the future so he will be able to provide his family with good living standards.

loans.use: to buy all needed assets to start his business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina works hard to support her family. She is married and has two children. Since November 8, 2007, her business is at home selling soft drinks, bottled water and biscuits.

She is now requesting a GHS 1,500 loan through ID-Ghana to purchase more soft drinks, bottled water and biscuits, and sell them to customers.

With this help, Faustina will be able to increase stock as soon as possible.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, bottled water and biscuits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Construyendo el país de la eterna primavera y del desarrollo, Adan de 29 años de edad casado con dos hijos  el primero tiene 6 años y es estudiante de la escuela de la comunidad y el segundo que apenas tiene cuatro meses de nacido, los hijos se a vuelto el más grande reto para el ya que tiene que hacer el esfuerzo de luchar por su familia cada día para darles un buen futuro y educación a sus hijos.

La actividad principal de el es la albañilería en la comunidad donde el vive, desde niño el tomo la decisión de aprender a construir casas de su comunidad dicha profesión a la venido trabajando desde hace 5 largos años de sacrificio pero que lo ha hecho con mucho orgullo parque lo hace por su familia porque necesitan de un ingreso económico para la satisfacción de las necesidades de su familia y para el desarrollo de su comunidad donde vive.

El propósito del crédito que el desea realizar es para la compra de herramientas de construcción en la albañilería ya que es de importancia para el y sin esas herramientas el no podrá trabajar para seguir construyendo en su comunidad.

Uno de los más grandes sueños de Adan es ver crecer a sus hijos y darle educación para que llegue a ser un profesional y poner una constructora para el servicio de su comunidad y el desarrollo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Building the country of eternal spring and of discovery is Adan, who is 29 years old and is married with two children. His first child is six years old and is a student in the community school; his second is only four months old. His children have given him a bigger challenge, so that he has to make the effort to fight for his family everyday to give them a good future and to give a good education to his children.

His main work is construction in the community where he lives. When he was a child, he decided that to learn to build houses in his community. He has been doing this work for 5 long years of sacrifice, but he has done it with a lot of pride because he does it for his family, since they need an income to satisfy their household needs, and for the development of the community where he lives. 

The goal of the loan will be to buy construction tools, since these are important for him. Without these tools, he will not be able to continue building in his community. 

One of his biggest dreams is to see his children grow and to give them an education so that they can become professionals. He also dreams of making a building that serves his community and its development for the future.

loans.use: to buy construction tools.

loans.name: Moko Sane Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two ladies whoare on their third loan cycle with ID-Ghana and from the same area. They share a strong social and professional bond. They are both into pedicure and manicure.

Abigail, age 30, is the group representative. She is single with three children, two boys and one girl, who are all going to school. 

She is a service provider in pedicure and manicure at the market. She has a good command of this work, having practiced this activity for a long time, therefore has a lot of experience. 

This new loan will help to buy accessories and cream so that she can serve her customers better. 

The profits earned help her to look after her children’s needs with respect to food, healthcare, and education.

loans.use: To buy accessories and cream so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 24-year-old single man. He is a decoration design specialist. Omar is one of seven members of his family and helps his father in supporting his siblings. That’s why Omar is applying for an education loan to pay for his sister’s semester fees. She is a law student in her second year and she has a part time job as a saleslady in a clothing store.

loans.use: To pay for his sister's semester fees.

loans.name: Nasimi

texts.en:
Nasimi is a 36-year-old married man. His wife is a housekeeper. They have two beautiful daughters and a son. Nasimi is a gardener, and he has been working in this field for 10 years. He has good experience and knows everything about gardening. His monthly income is 250 AZN.

Gardening is much expanded in Azerbaijan. People keep nice gardens with fruit trees and beautiful flowers. Different sanatoriums, schools, and business buildings have gardens, and gardeners work there. Nasimi works as a gardener in a local hospital’s garden. Every day he waters trees and flowers, and takes care of them properly.
 
Nasimi’s income doesn’t cover his family’s needs. He has his own garden, where he raises flowers and plants and sells them. He needs money in order to provide his children with an education. He applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to set up a pipeline to provide water to his garden.

loans.use: to set up a pipeline to provide water to his garden

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim is a 41-year-old farmer. He is married and has two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper. Rahim has been working as a farmer for 18 years and has a good experience in this area. He raises seasonal fruits and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 300 AZN.

Raising and selling fruits is much expanded in Azerbaijan. People sell seasonal fruits at the local bazaar. And buyers use fruits to make delicious kinds of jam, pies, cakes and juice. They also use dry fruits because it’s very useful for health.

Rahim’s situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for him. Because of this problem the productivity has fallen and he can’t cover the family’s needs. He applied for a 1100 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to be able to supply water to his garden weekly.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fridge for the shop to start selling cold drinks.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives with her daughter in Stepanavan city which is in the Lori region. Her husband is in the Russian Federation and from there he transfers money for his family. 

Anna graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute with the specialty of linguist and specialist of Armenian Language and Literature. Fpr 18 years already, she has worked in the pedagogical sphere and now she works at the Agricultural College in Stepanavan as a lecturer in Armenian Language. 

At her house in a separate and comfortable room, she also gives paid courses in Armenian Language, in that way preparing the pupils to pass the entrance examinations.

Now she asks for a loan of 400,000 AMD (Armenian drams) in order to buy a computer and some new professional literature, since both the computer and literature are very important equipment for a pedagogue during the working process.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some new professional literature

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja es albañil, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella.

Milagro se dedica a la venta de tortillas, realiza esta actividad desde que se acompañó, además fue influenciada por su madre quien vende tortillas en el mercado.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz y leña para poder continuar con la venta de tortillas.

Su sueño a futuro es tener una casa más grande en la cual pueda sentirse cómoda con su familia.
texts.en:
Milagro, 32, studied up to the ninth grade.  He has a common-law husband and her partner is a mason.  She has two children who depend on her.
Milagro makes a living in tortilla sales.  She has been doing this since she entered into the union with her husband.  In addition, she was influenced by her mother who sells tortillas in the market.
She needs the loan to buy corn and firewood in order to be able to continue with the tortilla sales.
Her dream for the future is to have a larger house in which she could feel comfortable with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood in order to be able to continue with the tortilla sales.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 35 años de edad, estudió solo un año en la universidad ya que por los problemas económicos decidió no continuar, está separado de su pareja y solo tiene una hija.

Él trabaja en una institución  donde capacita a las personas de escasos recursos económicos para que puedan realizar actividades productivas, aunque los ingresos de su trabajo no son suficientes, él se siente bien porque le sirve para ayudar a su hija.

Este crédito lo necesita para cancelar una deuda que tiene en un banco, ya que tuvo que recurrir al préstamo para cubrir gastos médicos de un familiar.

Sus deseos más grandes son ver a su hija crecer, que estudie y sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Carlos, 35, only studied at university for one year. Due to financial problems, he decided not to continue studying. He is separated from his partner and has one daughter.

He works in an institution where he trains people with limited financial resources so they can realize productive activities. Even though he does not receive sufficient earnings from his work, he feels good because it allows him to help his daughter.

He needs this loan to pay off his existing debt to a bank, because he had to take out a loan to cover a relative's medical expenses.

His greatest wishes are to see his daughter grow up and for her to study and be a good person.

loans.use: to pay off his existing debt to a bank for a loan he had to take out to cover a relative's medical expenses.

loans.name: Ana Yamileth

texts.es:
Ana de 21 años de edad,  estudió hasta noveno grado, ya que las condiciones económicas de su familia no le permitieron continuar sus estudios, está casada y su esposo presta servicios como vigilante, solo tiene un hijo de un año de edad, 

Ana se dedica a los oficios domésticos, también elabora petates para comercializarlos en la zona, este trabajo lo hace por la necesidad de tener ingresos económicos, este trabajo lo aprendió desde muy pequeña por sus padres.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar mallas de alambre para cerrar el terreno, tiene animales y se le pierden, pues corre el riesgo de que se los roben. 

Ella sueña con tener su casa amueblada y que sus hijo sea en un futuro un profesional.
texts.en:
Ana, 21, studied up until the ninth grade. Her family's financial conditions did not allow her to continue her studies. She is married and her husband works as a security guard. They have a one-year-old son.

Ana is dedicated to the household duties and also makes sleeping mats which she sells in the area. She does this job due to the need to earn a financial income. She learned about this work from a young age from her parents.

She needs this loan to buy wire mesh to close off her land. She has animals and when they get lost, she risks them being stolen.

She dreams of having her house furnished and for her son to be a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy wire mesh to close off her land, so her animals do not get lost or stolen.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a 42-year-old conservative mother, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Aziza has two daughters in the university. One of them is Maram, in her second year in the university, who is in the photo. Maram is majoring in chemistry. Having two children in the university at once is hard for the parents financially. The father is a carpenter and the brother is working selling aluminum. Yet they can’t always afford the girls' university fees, and that’s why Aziza is applying for a loan to pay for Maram’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's semester fees.

loans.name: Ever Alexander

texts.es:
Ever de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado, está soltero pero tiene 2 hijas a las cuales no ha dejado de apoyar económicamente. 

Ever se dedica a trabajar en estructuras metálicas, hace portones, puertas, ventanas, pone techos en casas, etc. Además trabaja en albañilería.

Él necesita el crédito para terminar de cancelar una motocicleta que saco al crédito, también comprará muebles para su hogar. 

Sus sueños son tener casa propia, darles el estudio a sus hijas hasta que sean profesionales y rehacer su vida sentimental con otra persona.
texts.en: Ever is 27 years old. He studied up to 4th grade. He is single, but he has two daughters whom he has not stopped supporting financially. Ever works in metallic structures. He makes gates, doors, windows; he puts roofs on houses, etc. Also he works in masonry. He needs a loan to pay off a motorcycle that he got on credit. He will also buy furniture for his home. His dreams are to have his own house, to give an education to his daughters so they are professionals, and to have a new love life with another person.

loans.use: to finish paying off a motorcycle that he got on credit and also to buy furniture for his home.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 51-year-old married woman. For the past seven years, she has been involved in a business of selling cloth. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Irshad is in her eighth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. Irshad expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors

loans.name: Mehpara

texts.en:
Mehpara is a 55-year-old married woman. Her husband is a taxi driver and they have two daughters and a son. Mehpara is a seller in a small local shop. She sells daily products such as bread, butter, cheese, cookies, water, tea, sugar, etc. She has worked in this place for 35 years and her monthly income is 250 AZN.

Daily products are in high demand in Azerbaijan. People buy bread every morning. They buy tea, cookies, and pies for holidays and parties. Selling daily products is a much expanded business.

Mehpara is a very kind woman and she knows the demands of her clients. But her income doesn’t cover the family’s needs. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to supply more products and enlarge her assortment. This will increase the income of the shop and Mehpara’s salary will rise.

loans.use: to supply more products and enlarge her assortment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies to maintain her coffee crops in the new season.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian de 27 años de edad,  estudió hasta 9° grado  en la escuela, actualmente está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos, su pareja se dedica a trabajar en un mototaxi y la apoya con los gastos del hogar.


Mirian se dedica al comercio de ropa, tiene 6 años de realizar esta actividad,  para comprar la ropa tiene que viajar 35 km a otra ciudad y se va en bus, también ella tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 4 años, de modo que busca la forma de obtener ingresos para su familia.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, y comprará productos para su tienda como azúcar, café, arroz, etc. 

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando fuerte en sus negocios para brindarles los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirian is 27 years old and studied in school through 9th grade. She is currently in a relationship, and she has 2 children. Her partner makes a living working a motorcycle taxi, and he helps her with household expenses.

Mirian makes a living selling clothes. She has been doing this for 6 years. In order to buy the clothes, she needs to travel 35 km to another city, and she goes by bus. For the past 4 years, she has also had a small store. She, therefore, looks for ways to earn an income for her family.

She needs a loan to buy clothes such as pants, shirts, and underwear and to buy products for her store such as sugar, coffee, rice, etc.

She dreams of continuing to work hard at her businesses so that she can give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as pants, shirts, and underwear and to buy products for her store such as sugar, coffee, rice, etc.

loans.name: Aichurek

texts.ru: Айчурек 52 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование - среднее. Уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес с нуля. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Айчурек достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 17,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айчурек имеется 5 коров, также 1,60 Га арендованной и 1,30 собственной земли, где Айчурек выращивает хлопок, клевер, рис и помидоры для реализации. По хозяйству помогают супруг и младшие дети. Корм для скота Айчурек выращивает и заготавливает сама. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айчурек обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Айчурек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, и накопить на образование дочери, которая очень хочет стать врачом.
texts.en:
Aichurek is 52 and married with five children. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years, a business she began from nothing. Thanks to her backbreaking effort and hard work, she has achieved great success in developing her farm and now brings in a monthly profit of 17,000 KGS. She now has five cows as well as 1.6 hectares of rented land and 1.3 hectares of owned land where she grows cotton, clover, rice and tomatoes for sale with the help of her husband and younger children. She also grows and prepared feed for her animals by herself.

With the goal of further developing her business, Aichurek has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 135,000 KGS to purchase cattle. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock and to save toward the education of her daughter, who wants to be a doctor.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to be more profitable and pay for her daughter's higher education in medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, canned foods, chicken, meat, cleaning products, and other goods.

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en:
Jamileh is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the photo.

Jamilah is a 45-year-old mother who is applying for this loan to support her son’s education and pay for his upcoming semester fees. Her son is 18 years old now. He is a freshman student at one of the Jordanian universities majoring in physics.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 62 años de edad, no estudió y solo aprendió a leer y escribir por sus hijos, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Julio se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, además los días viernes sale a las plazas a comercializar  cumas, corbos,  hachas, lazos etc. Ya tiene muchos años de dedicarse a estos trabajos por lo tanto es muy reconocido por las personas de su comunidad.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y comprar cumas, corbos,  hachas, lazos para comercializar.

Él sueña con poner un negocio fijo en el pueblo y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 62 years old. He did not study and only learned to read and write because of his children. He is married, and his wife performs household chores.

Julio makes a living growing corn and beans. In addition, on Fridays, he goes to the plazas and sells machetes, curved knives, axes, ropes, etc. He has been doing this work for many years. Therefore, he is well-known by the people in his community. 

He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies as well as machetes, curved knives, axes, and ropes to sell.

He dreams of establishing a permanent business in town and moving forward with his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies as well as machetes, curved knives, axes, and ropes to sell.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 42 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela pero ha aprendido a firmar ya que sus hijos le han enseñado, su esposo es agricultor y albañil, procrearon 7 hijos pero solo 6 viven en casa.

María se dedica a tejer petates ya que ellos cosechan tule, y en la zona es bueno el comercio de ese producto, también tiene una tienda, sus hijos le ayudan en todas las actividades que realiza con el objetivo de salir adelante como familia.

Ella necesita el crédito para pagar productos que ha encargado para su tienda, también para comprar abonos para los cultivos de su esposo.

Sus sueños son aumentar el inventario de la tienda, y mejorar las condiciones de su casa, también sueña con que sus hijos estudien y consigan mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
María, 42, did not go to school. However, she learned to sign her name because her children taught her. Her husband is a farmer and construction worker. They have seven children, but only six live at home.

María makes a living sewing sleeping mats, because they grow tule reeds. In their area, trade of these products is good. She also has a store. Her children help her with all of her activities, with the goal of moving forward as a family.

She needs this loan to pay for products she ordered for her store, as well as to buy fertilizer for her husband's crops.

Her dreams are to increase her store's inventory and to improve the conditions of her house. She also dreams of her children studying and getting better jobs.

loans.use: to pay for products she ordered for her store and to buy fertilizer for her husband's crops.

loans.name: Grupo Pochol Sector Campo Group

texts.es:
De 23 años de edad soltera originaria del departamento de Suchitepéquez, ella realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad ella es una mujer emprendedora y que dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro para tener una condición de vida adecuada. (Maria es la que se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía)
