She has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a new collection of cloth for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of cloth for the winter season

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 49-year-old married woman with two children. For the past five years, she has been involved in the business of clothing trade. She purchases clothes of different varieties at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Farhat is in her fourth loan cycle and she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She wants to buy a greater variety of clothes in different colors and sizes for her business. Farhat expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy greater variety of clothes in different colors and sizes

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 51 years old and she has four children who are still in school.

Lorna has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her weaving business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lorna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. Mercedita is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more abaca fiber for her weaving business.

Mercedita has been in this business for four years now.

Mercedita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more abaca fiber for her weaving business

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 36-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has three children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 54-year-old woman. She is a married woman and she is a mother of four children. Shamim and her husband have been doing agricultural work for many years. By cropping she earns good amount of income to meet their everyday expenses. She wants a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides. She is in her third loan cycle and she has a good credit history. She is motivated and hopeful that this loan amount will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old, married and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with five children. She keeps livestock and sells clothes. Her spouse provides additional income to support the family.

She will be using this loan to buy cattle feed for her cows. She will also buy clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to grow her business. 

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya and she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mariuxi Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Playa Prieta. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, es este lugar la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariuxi,  tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 3 años. Su marido es obrero trabaja en obras de construcción vial.
Doña Mariuxi es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica  a la venta de  ropa de todo tipo y zapatos por catalogo, vende en su casa o puerta a puerta ya que  sale tres días por semana más que todo  las mañanas ya que a esa hora le es más fácil ir a visitar a sus clientes, deja a créditos y cobra cada ocho días lo cual le sirve para cobrar e ir vendiendo nuevamente. Tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo.
Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar ropa y zapatos por catalogo. Lleva seis ciclos  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
In the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo, the members of the "Playa Prieta" loan group meets every fortnight. Calderón is known for its delicious culinary tradition and its vegetation. Here the majority of inhabitants make a living in farming and trade.

And it is here that 27-year-old Mariuxi lives. She is married and the couple has a three-year-old daughter. Marixui's husband is a labourer; he works building roads.

Mariuxi is someone who likes to look after herself, earn her own income and help pay household costs. She makes a living selling clothes and shoes of all types. She sells out of her home and makes door-to-door sales three days per week. She works in the morning as it is easier to visit her customers then. Mariuxi sells on credit and collects payments every week, allowing her to sell at the same time. Mariuxi has been doing this work for six years and with it she earns her own income.

This loan will be used to buy shoes and clothes from catalogues. Mariuxi has been with the loan group for six cycles and she likes it as loans are distributed quickly and help her a lot. Mariuxi's dream is to give her daughter the best that she can.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad tiene 40 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado, por las mañanas trabajaba en la agricultura y por las tardes asistía a la escuela, ahora está acompañado y tiene dos hijas.

Trinidad trabaja desde muy pequeño en la agricultura, aprendió de su padre quien con mucho orgullo trabajaba y cultivaba la tierra, además se dedica al comercio de verduras y productos básicos y los fines de semana se dedica al destazo de cerdo, de esta forma puede llevar el sustento diario a su familia y ser responsable con sus compromisos financieros.

Él necesita el crédito para ampliar su negocio de venta de verduras, invertirá en el destazo de cerdos y también comprará dos llantas para su vehículo.

Las proyecciones que tiene para un futuro son tener un mejor vehículo para trasportar su mercadería, mejorar su vivienda y comenzar a montar una granja de cerdos y de gallinas ponedoras en el predio de su casa.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 40 years old and has a fourth grade education. In the mornings he works in farming and, in the afternoons, attends school. He has a partner and two daughters.

Trinidad has been working in farming since he was very young. He learned the trade from his father who proudly worked the land and grew crops. Trinidad also sells vegetables and staple goods, and at the weekend he slaughters pigs. This work allows him to bring home an income for his family and to be responsible with his financial obligations.

Trinidad needs this loan in order to expand his vegetable selling business, to invest in slaughtering pigs and to buy two tyres for his vehicle.

Trinidad's plans for the future include owning a better vehicle for transporting merchandise, improving his home, and starting a farm with pigs and laying hens on the land attached to his house.

loans.use: to expand his vegetable selling business, to invest in slaughtering pigs and to buy two tyres for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for five years now. Her spouse provides additional income to support the family.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to be successful in her business and live a better life with her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase many gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: Nicolie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nicolie works hard to support her family.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Nicolie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials and tools for her weaving business.

Nicolie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and tools for her weaving business

loans.name: Inés Virginia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.
En este lugar vive la señora Inés, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  19, 16, 13 y 9 años, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Inés trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta, ella realiza el crédito  para ayudarle a su esposo a sacar adelante un negocio, él tiene una pequeña fábrica de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), en este lugar el junto con el suegro se encargan de elaborar y vender los ladrillos, ellos le entregan sus productos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su fabrica para luego llevarlos a distintos lugares donde venden estos productos, llevan más de 11 años dedicados a esta actividad la misma que le deja muy buenas satisfacciones.
Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín, agua y palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar los ladrillos. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ayuda a su marido. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its large variety of typical products, such as the nationally and internationally famous straw Panama hats. The members of the loan group La Dolorosa Del Pechiche meet every 15 days.

Ines lives in this place. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children with her partner, aged 19, 16, 13, and 9. The three older ones are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband is an artisan.

Inés works in a factory in the city of Manta. She is taking out the loan to help her husband move forward with his business; he has a small brick factory (the bricks are for building houses) and he works there with her father-in-law to make and sell the bricks. They sell their products to traders who come to the factory and bring the bricks elsewhere to sell them.

This loan is to buy firewood, sawdust, water, and palm fibers, which are the materials used to make the bricks. Inés has been with this loan group for seven years, and she likes it because this way she can help her husband. Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sawdust, water, and palm fibers

loans.name: Ángel Gerardo

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.
En este lugar vive don Ángel, tiene 52 años de edad, hace varios años su esposa falleció pero de esta  relación tuvo 7 hijos, 4 de ellos ya son mayores de edad, los  tres menores tienen 15, 12 y 10 años y  estudian en colegio y escuela, 5 de ellos aun vive con él.
El señor Ángel es un hombre que le ha tocado trabajar toda la vida para sacar adelante a su familia, él se dedicaba a la agricultura pero este trabajo es duro y casi no hay trabajo en todo el año es por esta razón que hace 2 años surtió en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres y  trabaja el con la ayuda de sus hijos, de esta forma el se gana el sustento para él y sus familia.
Este crédito es para  comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir aun más su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 2 ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its wide variety of traditional products, like the paja toquilla hats known inside and outside of the country, the members of the La Dolorosa Del Pechiche credit group meet every two weeks.

This is where Ángel lives. He is 52 years old and several years ago his wife died. He has 7 children from the relationship. Four of them are grown and the three younger ones are 15, 12 and 10. Five of them still live with him. 

Ángel is a man who has had to work all of his life to get his family ahead. He worked in agriculture but that work is hard and there is almost always no work year round and that is why he opened a little grocery store in his house 2 years ago. He sells all types of groceries there and works with the help of his children. In this way, he supports himself and his family. 

This loan is to buy staple products to increase the stock in his store. He has been in the Credit Group for 2 cycles and he finances his business with the loans.

loans.use: to buy staple products.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 30 years old. She is married with five children. With three children currently in school, Richel works very hard to provide for them.

Richel runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc., to sell.

Richel has been in this business for six years and she sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Richel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita works hard to support her family. Rodita is married and she has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Rodita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her weaving business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rodita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is 50 years old and married. Mwikali and her spouse have been blessed with one child who is now a grown up. Mwikali does farming in Tala Town, where she grows maize, beans and vegetables to sell. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to buy more stock of fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family and expand her business.

She paid her previous loan well and in the future she hopes to improve her farming and be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Elvita Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.
En este lugar vive la señora Elvita, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Elvita para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo, cuando ellos pueden, pero por lo general es ella la que mas pasa en su negocio. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para el beneficio de su familia ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 5 años y le gusta porque así saca adelante su tienda. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its wide variety of traditional products, such as the paja toquilla hats, known in and out of the country, the  La Dolorosa Del Pechiche creidt group meets evert two weeks. 

This is where Elvita lives. She is 49 years old, married and from the relationship has four grown children. One of them still lives with her. Her husband works in agriculture. 

In order to get ahead, Elvita and her family have a convenience store in their house. She sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., sometimes later. Her son and her husband help her at work when they can, but generally she is the one who spends the most time at the business. She has done this activity for five years and with it she earns her income to benefit her family since her husband doesn't earn a lot with the agricultural work. 

She is going to use this loan to stock her store up more. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, deli meats, and other staple products. She has been in the credit group for 5 years and she likes it because she is getting her store ahead. Her goals are to get ahead in her business and for her store to grow more day to day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, deli meats and other staple products.

loans.name: Gladis Mercedes

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladis, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. 
Doña Gladis es una muy buena madre que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella con la ayuda de su hijo tienen una ladrillera, allí su hijo  con la ayuda de otras personas se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas),  ellos entrega en el sitio a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar para trasladarlos hasta las ciudades cercanas donde son utilizados, mientras su hijo se encarga de la fabricación de los ladrillos ella se encarga de las ventas desde su hogar, ya son más de 20 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar madera, tierra y otros materiales para elaborar los ladrillos. Lleva más de 10 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “La Dolorosa del Pechiche” meets fortnightly in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city that is famous for the diversity of its products, for example the “Panama hat”, which is well-knonwn locally and abroad.

This is where Gladis, 60, lives. She is a single mother of three children who are adults now. One still lives with her. Gladis is a very good mother and likes to work to get ahead. She makes bricks, helped by her son and other employees. These bricks are used to build houses. She sells these bricks to businesspeople who then take them to the cities where they will be used, while her son makes them. She works from home and has been selling bricks for more than twenty years to get ahead. 

With this loan, she wants to buy wood, clay and other materials she needs to make bricks. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than ten years and she enjoys it, since these loans help her. Her dream is to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy wood, clay and other materials to make bricks.

loans.name: Patricia Amarilis

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Patricia tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 9 y 5 años, todos estudian  en escuela. Su esposo  se dedica a la pesca en ocasiones y también realiza fletes en una moto taxi.
Doña Patricia es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatos y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres  días a la semana unas dos a tres  horas al día y en los momentos que está desocupada, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana, además los fines de semana ella con el esposo alquilan sillas y carpas a los turistas que llegan hasta este lugar. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y toldos ya que los que tiene ya están dañados y necesita renovarlas. Lleva más de 6 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener bien construida su casa ya que aún le falta mucho.
texts.en:
In the seaside town of  San Clemente, the 1 de Diciembre credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are much frequented by nationals and international tourists. It had a wide diversity of beautiful beaches and a rich variety of traditional regional dishes.
   
This is where Patricia lives. She is 32 years old, married, and from that relationship has three children, aged 11, 9 and 5. They are all in school. Her husband works as a fisherman sometimes and also makes deliveries in a motor cycle taxi.
 
Patricia is a great housewife who in order to make her own income sells shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells door to door and works three days a week one to three hours a day and when she has free time. She sells on credit and collects every week. Also, on weekends, she and her husband rent out chairs and tents to tourists who come to town. She has been doing this activity for 10 years and it is going very well for her. 

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and sunshades since the ones she has are damaged and need to be renewed. She has been in the credit group for more than 6 years and she likes it because of the help from the loans. Her dreams are to finish building her house because it is a long way from being finished.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics and sunshades.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad está casada y de esta relación  tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es obrero.
Doña María es una gran ama de casa que para ganar el sustento diario y para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar ya que este no gana mucho, se dedica a la venta de  vende bocadillos, comida rápida, sodas, aguas, jugos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 15h00 hasta las 21h00, le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y es así como ella contribuye con los gastos del hogar y mucho más cuando su esposo se queda sin trabajo, lleva más de 23 años con este negocio el cual le ha servido para sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar carne, sodas, jugos y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos salen muy rápido y sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The communal bank “1 de Diciembre” meets fortnightly in the coastal city of San Clemente. This city is famous for its beautiful beaches, which are popular with local and foreign tourists. Visitors can enjoy different places and traditional food.

This is where María, 50, lives. She is married and has three adult children; two of them still live with her. Her husband is a construction worker and she works as a housewife. Her husband does not earn much, so she sells sandwiches, fast food, beverages, water, juices and other things in order to help him with the home expenses. She works every day from 15:00 until 21:00 and has been doing well so far. Thanks to her business, she can contribute to the home economy, especially when her husband is unemployed. She has been doing this for more than twenty-three years, and it has helped her to make headway with her family.

María will use this loan to buy meat, beverages, juices and other ingredients to prepare food. She is a member of the communal bank since the beginning and enjoys it because she receives the loans easily and without so many requirements. Her dream is to open a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy meat, beverages, juices and other ingredients.

loans.name: Roqueta

texts.en:
Roqueta is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Roqueta is 36 years old and she has one child who is currently in school.

Roqueta has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Roqueta requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business.

Roqueta has been in this business for three years. Roqueta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is appreciative of her previous loan that saw her improve her business and living standards.

Catherine still operates her weaving business. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy reeds for her business.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy reeds for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Edita

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella y estudia en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Blanca para ganarse la vida y  la de su familia junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual juntos  trabajan día a día para que esta mejore aun mas, allí venden  todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y veces hasta más tarde, además de estos productos también venden carne, pollo, pescado y útiles escolares. Lleva más de 15 años con su negocio con el cual han sacado adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de  6 años  y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the resort town of San Clemente, the communal bank '1 de Diciembre meets every 15 days. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which receive a lot of visits from tourists national and international. It offers many different beautiful places and a rich and delicious variety of traditional foods from the region.
This is where Blanca lives. She is 56 years old, married, and has three adult children from her marriage. One of them is still living with her, and studies at university. Her husband is a trader.
Blanca, to make a living for herself and her family, works in commerce together with her husband. They have a general store in their house, where they both work day by day to improve it even more. There they sell all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and more. They work every ay from 6AM to 8PM and sometimes until even later. They also sell meat, chicken, fish, and school supplies. They have had the store for more than 15 years and this is how they have supported their children.
Blanca will use this loan to stock her store with more supplies. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other essential products. She has been with the communal bank for more than six years, and she likes it because of the benefits the institution  offers. Her goals are to keep moving forward with her business and to expand her store even more.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other essential products

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman, with two children who are in school. She is 32 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF, to buy more abaca fiber for her weaving business.  Rosalie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more abaca fiber for her weaving business

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
There previous loan granted to Mejuma really improved her business and her standard of living.
With the loan of Kshs 25,000, Mejuma wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 40 years old, married with 3 children aged between 7 and 1.  All the children go to school. He has been farming for 8 years.  The loan from Kiva,  will be used to buy more fertilizer for Irish potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre 20 years old, is married with a one year old child.  He has been farming for 2 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy domestic animals such as goats. The profits from the business will be used to buy fertilizer for Irish potatoes.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy domestic animals such as goats.

loans.name: Wedzine

texts.en:
Wedzine is grateful for her previous loan that improved her living standard. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and increse her income.

She would like to be granted a loan to buy more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice, and sugar. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their continued financial partnership

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Nikkolus

texts.en:
Nikkolus sells shoes in Tala town and has been in this business for 3 years. He is 35 years old, married and with his spouse, been blessed with 8 children. 

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of shoes for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

This is his second loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in future he hopes to expand his business and be more successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes for sale

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Didas 36 years old, is married with 3 children aged between 9 and 15, all of whom go to school.  He has been farming for 6 years.  With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for Irish potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to improve his savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 36 years old, married with 2 children ages 4 and 7.  The older child goes to school. He has been farming for 7 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Consessa

texts.en:
Consaisa aged 53 years, married with 7 children aged between 14 and 30.  Three of her children go to school.  She has been farming for 13 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for Irish potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Diogene

texts.en:
Diogene is 55 years old, married with 6 children aged between 18 and 31.  Four of them go to school. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Thiedo's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc village a été créé le 22 Avril  2007,  il regroupe des femmes qui partagent des liens de solidarité très solide du fait de leur compagnonnage pendant plus de cinq bonnes années soit 12 cycles actuellement. Les membres sont désireux de développer des activités génératrices de revenus ainsi améliorer les conditions d’existence facilitant l’accès aux produits de consommation courante. Ces femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, elles pratiquent aussi la culture sous pluies.

Madame Thièdo (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont 03 filles et 02 garçons. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de produits de consommation courante savon, sucre, thé, assaisonnement et divers autres produits alimentaires.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter 03 sacs de sucre pour 66 000 Fr FCA, 04 cartons de savon à 24 000 Fr FCA et quels que paquets de bouillons culinaires pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was set up on 22nd April 2007 and is made up of women who enjoy strong solidarity due to their companionship during more than five good years and 12 loan cycles. The members would like to develop their income-generating activities and  improve their living conditions, thus facilitating their access to everyday consumer products. These women are mainly active in small trading businesses, and they also practise farming in the rain. 

Thièdo (who is sitting on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and mother to five children, three girls and two boys. She sells everyday consumer products, such as soap, sugar, tea, seasonings and various other food products. With her new loan she is going to buy three sacks of sugar for 66,000FCFA, four cartons of soap for 24,000FCFA and several packets of cooking stock for resale on a retail basis. 

The profits she makes will allow her to help her husband to provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of sugar for 66,000FCFA, four cartons of soaps for 24,000FCFA and several packets of cooking stock for resale on a retail business.

loans.name: In God Group

texts.en:
The "In God" group is on its third loan cycle and are six in number. They are selling food, fried yam, potato, fish, cold store, second-hand clothing, corn dough and soap. This loan will help the group take care of their families.

One member of the group is Elizabeth, who makes a living operating a cold store and a chop bar. Elizabeth wants to get ahead and is sacrificing certain things in order to have a better quality of life for herself and her loved ones. She is married with children.

Elizabeth is applying for this loan in order to buy fish and chicken to stock her cold store and ingredients to cook food and sell to customers. She can then fight for a higher income to take care of her family.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy fish and chicken to stock her cold store and ingredients to cook food and sell to customers.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia requested another loan from Yehu for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fabric and another sewing machine

loans.name: Kuzerkan

texts.ru: Кузеркан 57 лет, замужем, мать 2 сыновей. У Кузеркан среднее образование. С 1990 года занимается животноводством, мастер в своем деле. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. В хозяйстве Кузеркан есть 4 коровы, 20 овец, 2 лошади.  Ежемесячная прибыль Кузеркан составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и нетели. Доходы от кредита Кузеркан направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также она хочет купить автомобиль для своей семьи.
texts.en: Kuzerkan is 57, married, and the mother of two sons. She has a high school education and has been raising livestock since 1990 and is a master of her work. Her family helps her on the farm. Kuzerkan currently has 4 cows, 20 sheep, and 2 horses and earns 15,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her livestock business, Kuzerkan applied for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and a calf. She wants to use her profits to continue developing her business and to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and a calf

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Peruvian artisan Fernando specializes in alpaca apparel. He would like to invest in the bulk purchase of alpaca and sheep's wool for production.Fernando has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"My artistic origins come from my family. My uncles worked in textiles and little by little they introduced me to this world. I love being able to translate materials into beautiful designs. My work means everything to me: it's what I love and cherish, and I love the fact that I can provide for my family thanks to it.

"I would like to thank you very much for this microcredit. It will enable me to prepare for the holiday season as well as work on my new designs by stocking up on wool, my primary material."

Use the link below to view Fernando's alpaca apparel on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7883">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7883

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca and sheep's wool for production

loans.name: Giuliana

texts.en:
Giuliana is an artisan who specializes in silver filigree jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver. Giuliana has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story: Peru's Giuliana says, "As a child, I loved creating my own jewelry to wear at parties, or to give as gifts to friends. My designs speak of tradition yet are modern, and they feature the harmony between metal, pearls and gemstones. I'd like to show the world the hand-crafted filigree styles developed in Peru over the centuries. I have researched the theme at length and my findings have led me to experiment with many great materials. Andean opal is my favorite. "I am truly thankful for all of your support. This microcredit allows us to continue expanding and furthering our art, which is truly our passion and our way of life. The work we pour into each piece we craft is rewarded with the support and generosity of each of you." Use the link below to view Giuliana's silver filigree jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4994

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver

loans.name: Nyebu Bi Yoonda - Zokugu Group

texts.en:
Sanatu is an active woman of 55 years from Zokugu in the northern part of Ghana. She is married and has six children. She is the person squatting on the bottom right hand side in their group picture. 

Sanatu is a member of a shea butter extracting group that has been harvesting and processing shea nuts over the last 20 years. Their group is called Nyebu Bi Yoonda - Zokugu. Sanatu makes good profits from the business since she and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana on improved ways of processing quality nuts for both the local market in Ghana and the export markets. 

Sanatu and the group have asked for a loan of GHS 5,000. Her share of the loan will help her buy four bags of shea nuts. By so doing, she would earn more income and hence repay this loan, support her children’s education, family food and health needs.

loans.use: To buy four bags of shea nuts.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino, who works alongside his wife, Agripina, is an artisan who specializes in alpaca and wool weavings. He would like to expand his workshop and invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

Faustino has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"My parents and grandparents were artisans. I learned at an early age to weave on rustic looms, to prepare the warp and spin the wool. Our family motto has been: I will never let go of either my grandfather or grandson's hands, for what I have learned from the elders, I will teach to the young. Based on this family philosophy, our work today represents the art that has been passed down from generation to generation within my family."

"Many thanks to each of you for this microcredit. We will use it to expand our workshop and purchase a large amount of alpaca wool. We consider each of you to be very special people and we will keep you always in our hearts."

Use the link below to view Faustino's alpaca and wool weavings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/705

loans.use: to expand his workshop and invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool

loans.name: With God Group

texts.en:
The With God group is composed of five women who all live in nuclear families. On average, they are 36 and have two children. They all live in Teshie, a neighborhood in Accra, Ghana.

They met through neighbors, relatives, and their income-generating activities around the neighborhood. They are into retail (beads, bed sheets, slippers, chop bar and fresh fish). In order to increase their business, they have decided to collaborate with ID-Ghana; this is their fifth loan cycle.

Mildred has a great reputation in the neighborhood and around, as a seller of beads. She plans on using her loan to buy more beads. She resells them at the market to various customers.

With this loan, Mildred hopes to make a good monthly profit, which will be used to cover small expenses for her children, as well as to increase her business. She wishes to keep collaborating with ID-Ghana.

They will surely hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more beads.

loans.name: Sulita

texts.en:
Sulita is 30 years old and unmarried with one child. She owns and operates a shop, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. 

Sulita needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, soft drinks, rice, canned food, frozen goods, snacks and a new chest freezer. 

She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, soft drinks, rice, canned food, frozen goods, snacks and a new chest freezer

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is a 57-year-old divorced woman with 6 children. She has a small kava farm and she enjoys the  monthly harvest.  She has sold kava in her community or at the market.for 2 years. 

Lesina needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, a spade and kava plants. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Lesina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, a spade and kava plants.

loans.name: Lotu

texts.en:
Lotu is a 51-year-old  divorced woman with 4 children. She has a small vegetable garden to grow cabbages to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year.

 Lotu needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves, and a  hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Lotu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves. and a hose.
