texts.en:
Luaono is a 52-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Luaono needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, chemicals, and new gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Luaono will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, chemicals, and new gloves.

loans.name: Sua

texts.en:
Sua is a 45-year-old  married woman with 7 children. She has a small plantation to grow bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Sua needs a loan to buy crops, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, a spade, a tiller, fertilizer, and a new machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Sua will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, a spade, a tiller, fertilizer, and a new machete

loans.name: Matautu

texts.en:
Matautu is a 56-year-old single woman with 7 children. She has had a small taxi business for 3 years. 

Matautu needs a loan to buy new tires, new seat covers, a taxi sign indicator, new shocks, and a timing belt. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Matautu joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tyres, new seat covers, a taxi sign indicator, new shocks, and a timing belt.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is an artisan from Peru who specializes in silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

He has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"Jewelry is my life. It fascinates me. Each design is like a child to me. My artistic formation began when I was 12, when my older sister married an experienced silversmith. I was an apprentice at his workshop, and then became a master silversmith too. I love the thrill of working on new designs."

"A big thank you to each of you who makes this microcredit possible. It will really help me to accelerate creation of new pieces ahead of the busy season, and this in turn will have a positive impact on my sales and help improve the quality of life for my family and the future prospects of my children."

Use the link below to view Victor's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7269

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a 24-year-old single woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Matilda needs a loan to buy chemicals, a spade, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a new machete, and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

Matilda will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a spade, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a new machete, and gloves.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is from the Dominican Republic. She has more than 30 years of experience in the hair salon business; she has had hair salons in the Dominican Republic, Haiti, and New York.  Her area of expertise is haircuts and treatments. In July 2013, Bienvenida opened a hair salon, Bienmary, in Baltimore. 

The business revenue is increasing and Bienvenida is applying for a $6,000 loan to remodel the bathroom and the facade of the hair salon. She also is equipping the business with a new  hair dressing station that she is going to rent out to another hair dresser.

loans.use: to remodel the bathroom and facade and add an additional workstation

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in ceramic ornaments and figurines. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including paints, varnish, thinner, clay, and firewood for his oven. Mario has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story: Mario says, "For a very long time, my family has passed our work techniques as well as the art of ceramic and painting from generation to generation. One of the best artisans in our town, my father began patiently teaching us this art form when we were quite young. I remember that the first things I made were little shepherds and sheep for the nativity scenes I imagine were used in homes. Then I learned to make more complicated figures that demanded a great deal of patience to paint – I made angels, butterflies and birds. "Many thanks and blessings for your support!" Use the link below to view Mario's ceramic ornaments and figurines on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7770

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including paints, varnish, thinner, clay, and firewood for his oven

loans.name: Iuliana

texts.en:
Iuliana is a 55-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 9 years. 

Iuliana needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, a new machete, a tiller, and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. 

Iuliana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, a new machete, a tiller, and crops.

loans.name: Sula

texts.en:
Sula is a 33-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small vegetable garden to grow cabbages and tomatoes to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Sula needs a loan to buy a new  hose, chemicals, fertilizer, seeds, gloves, and a pitch-fork. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

 Sula will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new hose, chemicals, fertilizer, seeds, gloves and a pitch-fork.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 38-year-old single woman with 3 children. She owns and operates a small store to sell a variety of items. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Rosa needs a loan to buy snacks, frozen goods, soft drinks, canned food, and a new display refrigerator. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, frozen goods, soft drinks, canned food, and a new display refrigerator.

loans.name: Simalu

texts.en:
Simalu is a 42-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Simalu needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new spade, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Simalu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new spade, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, and new overalls.

loans.name: Veota

texts.en:
In early 2014, Veota started Shopaholic Fashionista  (http://shopaholicfashionista.com/) in Buffalo, NY. Its mission: “Helping women feel and look fabulous with beautiful affordable clothing.” 

Veota loves clothes, accessories, and fashion and has always wanted to be an entrepreneur. She has lived in this country for over 30 years, immigrating from Thailand when she was just four years old. As her own boss, she says “the greatest success or opportunity I have had so far is that I get to meet new great people. Through customers or networking, it has allowed me to meet new people.”

Veota has both a store-front and a website. Her storefront is in a low foot traffic area and as a small business woman, she does not have a large marketing budget. Veota will use this loan to advertise and market to her target customers and increase sales. Veota knows that her business does more than support herself. “My business success will help create jobs. With financial success, I will become a philanthropist.”

loans.use: to pay for development of a marketing strategy and generate foot traffic.

loans.name: Edita María

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
Doña Edita es una mujer muy luchadora y que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar puso un pequeño restaurante en su casa, allí trabaja los fines de semana desde las 8h00 hasta las 20H00, ya que prepara desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas en estos días que es cuando más personas llegan hasta este hermoso lugar. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo para el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the seaside resort of San Clemente the "1 de Diciembre" communal bank meets each fortnight. This place is known for it's beautiful beaches and has many visitors both foreign and national. It offers them a variety of beautiful locations and a rich variety of traditional foods of the region.

Edita lives in this place. She is 52 years old, married and from this relationship has three adult children, one of which still lives with her. Her husband is a master builder.

Edita is very much a fighter and to help with the expenses of the household opened a small restaurant in her house. She works here on week-ends from 8 am until 8 pm. She prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner on those days as this is when most people arrive at this beautiful city. She works with the help of her son. She has been working in this business for more than 10 years in order to make something for the well-being of her family.

She will use the loan to buy rice, meat, fish fruit and other foods for the preparation of her meals. She has been with the communal bank since it's initiation and likes it because of the support provided by the loans. She dreams of getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, fruit and other foods.

loans.name: Lilo

texts.en:
Lilo is a 41-year-old  married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Lilo needs a loan to buy new boots, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, crops, and a new tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

Lilo will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new boots, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, crops, and a new tiller.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael needs a loan to buy new audio equipment for his freelance business. 

For the past six years, he has focused on recording audio for film and television in his home state of Florida. During this time, Michael has realized that this is his professional calling. “I want to record audio for film and television for the rest of my life,” he wrote.  Michael has two sons and as his business grows, he looks forward to providing opportunities for their future.

Michael understands the difficulty of contract work, saying, “I don’t have a set schedule. I work when the phone rings.”  Investing in his business is critical to ensure he has the most up-to-date capabilities new clients need. But, it can also be difficult to make these purchases because of the timing of jobs. Supporting Michael’s loan encourages his business to grow, and promotes easy listening of movies and TV!

loans.use: to pay for new audio equipment to help grow the business.

loans.name: Leleai

texts.en: Leleai is 21 years old and married with 1 child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Leleai needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, a tiller, crops and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Leleai will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new boots, a tiller, crops and a machete

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 50 years old and married with three children. Agustina works very hard to provide for them.

Agustina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Agustina has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as seasonings, candies, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, sugar, bread, etc. 

Agustina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 43 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Alfreda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, face powder, alcohol, canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, etc. 

Alfreda has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, face powder, alcohol, canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, face powder, alcohol, canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 52 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Carmela works very hard to provide for them.

Carmela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, biscuits, candies, juice, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell. Carmela has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, biscuits, candies, juice, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a business buying and selling native mats in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now. Gloria requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more native mats to sell.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more native mats to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 66 years old and married with six children. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cooking oil, cereals, shampoo, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a weaver from Oaxaca, Mexico who specializes in handwoven Zapotec rugs and handbags. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wool and increase the size of his workshop.

Mario has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I come from a family of weavers, it is a legacy I inherited from my great-grandfather. My aim is to preserve and promote the beauty of the Zapotec art. We dye the wool with natural colorants and we work on pedal looms."

"Creativity, imagination and transformation flow from the hands of artisans, who turn raw materials into works of art. It's a privilege to be able to share my art with the world, and with it a slice of my Zapotec culture and heritage."

Use the link below to view Mario's handwoven Zapotec rugs and handbags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4567

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wool and increase the size of his workshop

loans.name: Sepa

texts.en:
Sepa is a 30-year-old  married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Sepa needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, new gloves, a machete, a new wheelbarrow, and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Sepa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, new gloves, a machete, a new wheelbarrow, and crops.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is a 31-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Sophie needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a spade, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a tiller, and new gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Sophie will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a spade, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a tiller, and new gloves

loans.name: Finaumaleloto

texts.en:
Finaumaleloto is a 59-year-old married woman with 8 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Finaumaleloto needs a loan to buy new overalls, chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, crops, and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Finaumaleloto will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new overalls, chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, crops, and a tiller.

loans.name: Fitu

texts.en:
Fitu is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has run a small tailoring business for 5 years in her community. 

 Fitu has requested a loan to buy rolls of material, a new pair of scissors, thread, needles, and a measuring tape. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, a new pair of scissors, thread, needles and a measuring tape.

loans.name: Tuvaelagi

texts.en:
Tuvaelagi is a 36-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small vegetable garden to grow cabbages and tomatoes to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. T

uvaelagi needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, seeds, a tiller, a pitch fork, a crowbar, new boots, and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. 

Tuvaelagi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, seeds, a tiller, a pitch fork, a crowbar, new boots, and gloves.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe and his wife came to the United States almost a decade ago and they brought with them their extensive experience in TV production. They started New Sense Media LLC (http://new-sense-media.com/), a  homebased business that handles multiple visual mediums, from web design to animation. Felipe lists getting a contract with the State of Florida as one of his major accomplishments.

Felipe is able to provide his media services in the US as well as Latin America. His website provides an overview of New Sense Media LLC’s portfolio and gives a sample of the major international firms he was worked with.

Felipe needs a loan to develop a comprehensive marketing strategy to attract new clients to New Sense Media. This loan will also provide the opportunity for Felipe to invest in his business and build his credit.

loans.use: to pay for marketing strategy development.

loans.name: Andino Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ANDINO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silvia Carolina ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “ANDINO” communal bank which is located in the city of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, Cusco department.

Silvia Carolina is 50 years old, married and has three children. She works in the business of selling beauty products. She sells lipstick, creams and perfumes. She works from 8 am until 7 pm and has been in this business for several years. Her dream is to have a shop where she could sell her beauty products. She is requesting a loan to buy creams, lipstick and perfume.

The other members work in a variety of businesses like an internet business, selling clothing, a grocery store and a bookstore. The members thank those who form part of this dream through this loan and promise to comply with the payment of the installments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipstick and perfume.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
You never forget your childhood pleasures. In Steven’s case, he remembers learning to cook with his grandmother and watching her prepare the main meal for family holiday get-togethers – all the traditional Southern fare. 

As a grown man, he used many of the same tips and tricks for his own home entertaining, to rave reviews. With the encouragement of family and friends, he opened his own catering company (Soulful Delights, LLC – check them out on Facebook!), selling dinners on weekends. In addition to affirming his love of cooking, Steven says, “I’ve found out that I love to help and serve people. I love hosting and planning events that have to do with cooking.” Take a look at the comments on his facebook page – people love his food!  

Armed with his catering experience and his customer-focused attitude, Steven wants to open his own restaurant in his hometown of East Orange, NJ. Steven needs this loan to purchase equipment and supplies to get his restaurant up and running. Even though this is his first restaurant, Steven feels optimistic about the future. With the success of his catering company, he hopes to open a few restaurants in the area and manage them through his retirement.

loans.use: to pay for equipment and restaurant supplies.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aida is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Aida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Aida has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for three years now.

Alma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a wood carver from Ghana who specializes in African masks and carvings. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, stain and polish.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"While in junior high, I lived in a neighborhood where there are a lot of carvers and I assisted them in sandpapering masks and other carvings. This got me interested in woodcarving, and I also did well in art classes at school. After graduation, I decided to go back and assist the carvers. Even though they couldn't pay me much, I felt happy and satisfied, and was glad to go to work with each new day. Now I work on my own. The most challenging part of this craft is when am designing my work, and the nicest part is when I mix colors to paint. My hope is to become an excellent designer."

"I say thanks to those of you who contribute to this microcredit. My business earnings allow me to be able to cover the cost of my children's education. I ask God to bless you every day."

Use the link below to view Abdul's African masks and carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8770

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, stain and polish

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is an artisan from Mexico who specializes in ceramic replicas and figurines. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including clay, and gas for the ovens.

Angel has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Angel comes from a family with generations of artisan experience. He learned the family ceramic techniques from his father, Antonio, a renowned artisan. Angel began a long study of Mexico's pre-Hispanic cultures and learned the Nahuatl language spoken in ancient Mesoamerica. He uses clay from northern Oaxaca state, the only clay of this kind in Mexico and perhaps in the world. The unique characteristics of this yellow clay make it ideal for his work.

"I'd like to thank everyone who has supported us over the years. It has become difficult to find a local market for the items we craft. Being able to sell on the web not only provides a steady cash flow for me and my family, it helps ensure that our art will continue to be appreciated and gives meaning to what we do. We are so proud of our roots; being able to preserve even just a small piece of our rich cultural heritage by sharing it with the world gives us an indescribable feeling of satisfaction. Infinite thanks for your support and interest in our art. Many blessings to you all."

Use the link below to view Angel's ceramic replicas and figurines on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4012

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including clay, and gas for the ovens

loans.name: Selafina

texts.en:
Selafina is a 49-year-old divorced woman with 3 children. She owns and operates a small store to sell a variety of items. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Selafina needs a loan to buy canned food, a new hanging scale, cases of milk, soft drinks, and a small freezer. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy canned food, a new hanging scale, cases of milk, soft drinks, and a small freezer.

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en:
Ioana is a 37-year-old married woman with 6 children. 

She has made and sold pancakes in her community for 1 year.   Ioana needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, yeast, a large frying pan, cooking oil, and a new oven. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ioana has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, yeast, a large frying pan, cooking oil, and a new oven.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is a 65-year-old widow with 6 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Makerita needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, new boots, overalls, a machete, and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. 

Makerita will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer, new boots, overalls, a machete, and a spade.

loans.name: Laumua

texts.en:
Laumua is a 67-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation to grow taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Laumua needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, new boots, a new wheelbarrow, and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. 

Laumua will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, new boots, a new wheelbarrow, and a tiller.

loans.name: Vanessa Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Vanessa, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos de 9 años (gemelos) y uno de 3 años, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Vanessa es una mujer que le gusta ganar lo suyo para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, se dedica al comercio y la prestación de servicios,  tiene una copiadora en su casa donde trabaja casi todo el día realizando trabajos en digitación de documentos y el servicio de copiado, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo utilice en ciertos arreglos que necesita el carro que tiene y en el cual trabaja brindando el servicio de transporte, ella lleva 5 años con su negocio en el cual también vende ciertos suministros de oficina.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar hojas, suministros de oficina y repuestos para carro de su marido. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace más de  3 años  y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the Grupo de Credito 1 de Diciembre meet at the San Clemente spa.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches and is greatly visited  by national and international tourists.  It offers a lot of different, beautiful locations and a rich variety of local and regional food dishes.  Senora Vanessa lives here.  She is 32 years old, is married, and has 3 children, 2 of whom are 9 years old (twins) and one is 3 years old.  The older ones study at school.  Her husband is a chauffer.

Dona Vanessa is a woman that likes to earn what she can to help her husband with the household expenses.  She is dedicated to her business and providing services.  She has a copy business in her home where she does scanning and copying of documents almost all day.   She also sells office supplies. She has been in business for 5 years.  She will give part of the loan to her husband so that he can use it for certain repairs to his car that he uses to provide transportation services 

She is going to use the loan to buy paper, office supplies, and car parts for her husband.  She has been in the Loan Group for more than 3 years and  likes the benefits that it brings.  Her goals are to continue forward with her business and to have better health.

loans.use: to buy paper, office supplies and car parts.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in handcrafted jade and sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade.

Pablo has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

Pablo dreamed of being an artisan since he was a little boy. "My first piece of traditional silver work was a Maya design bracelet with quetzal birds, crafted when I was 11. Today, I dream of being able to leave my daughter art that has been in our family for several generations."

"I thank each of you for supporting me by way of this microcredit. These funds will help me to  prepare for the busy holiday selling season, which I hope will allow me to close out the year with a flourish."

Use the link below to view Pablo's handcrafted jade and sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7987">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7987

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade.

loans.name: Travis

texts.en:
Travis needs a loan to purchase tools, secure insurance, and pay suppliers. 

Travis has over 20 years of experience as an HVAC technician. Earlier this year, he decided to go into business for himself and knows he has the technical expertise to succeed. “I enjoy what I do,” Travis says, and he is looking forward to working for himself. “It’s a great feeling to be your own boss.”

With any new business, the start-up costs can be significant. Travis has a van, but needs funding to get tools and other services in place to really get off the ground. He will be working in his hometown area of Havana, Florida, as well as the surrounding towns.  With average temperatures getting above 80 degrees for most of the year, John needs to be prepared to provide high-quality service to his clients. This loan will help get his business going and help Florida residents keep cool!

loans.use: to pay for new tools and supplies to start his business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transportation business and earns additional income from food vending. Carmelita is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase a bicycle for her business.

Carmelita has sustained her business  through 2 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carolyn is 35 years old and has five children who are in school.

Carolyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Carolyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Carolyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Cresencia has been in this business for five years now.

Cresencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a general store for 20 years.

Bernardina requested 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Bernardina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has an internet cafe business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to pay for internet and electric bills. She has been in this business for two years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for internet and electric bills

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorna is 51 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Lorna has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 25 years old and works hard to support her family. Amelita sells roasted whole pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.

Amelita requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional pigs and pay for her laborers' salaries. In the future, Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and pay for her laborers' salaries

loans.name: Maria Rebecca

texts.en:
Maria Rebecca is married and works hard to support her family. She has a direct selling business where she offers Avon and personal collections in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Maria Rebecca requested a loan fro NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more products such as shoes, detergent, lipsticks, sandals, body spray, etc. to sell to her customers. Maria Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shoes, detergent, lipsticks, sandals, body spray, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement blocks and ceramic flooring.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is an artisan who specializes in wood sculptures and puzzle boxes. He would like to purchase bulk quantities of wood.

Salvador has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"My first carving was done with a tree root. I loved discovering images in the natural shape of the wood. I think what I like best about my work is how you can make any kind of figure from an ordinary piece of wood. Images from Maya art are the most difficult to do but they are pretty. It's interesting to work in an area that helps keep  the culture of our Maya ancestors and all the animals of our land alive. Almost all of my carvings are puzzles."

"Thanks to this microcredit, we will be able to increase the number of pieces we can craft which will help increase our income. Muchas gracias!"

Use the link below to view Salvador's wood sculptures and puzzle boxes on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8237">http://www.novica.com/kiva/8237

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of wood.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in wood sculptures and masks. He would like to purchase  bulk quantities of wood.

Diego has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

Diego left school at a young age to help his father work in the fields. Eventually, he began selling wooden masks and then learned to carve and paint them, while still helping his father. A devout Catholic, he then began carving images of saints. Today, he has taught his art to six people, and has been able to put his children, who are also wood carvers, through school. Diego is also an accomplished folk dancer.

"In these days of intense preparation for the upcoming holiday season, a little bit of help can go a long way towards encouraging us to keep crafting pieces. Many thanks, my friends from all around the world, for supporting artisans!"

Use the link below to view Diego's wood sculptures and masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7299">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7299

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of wood for his wood sculptures and masks.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса 22 года занимается тепличным хозяйством в с.Приветное. Развивая огородничество, она выращивает в теплицах раннюю рассаду, а на поле под пленкой — кабачки, капусту обычную, капусту цветную, перец, брокколи, помидоры, свеклу, лук.
Ларисе нужны 30 000 гривен для того, чтобы подготовить теплицы к предстоящему сезону, а именно — закупить удобрения и химикаты, пленку, агроволокно, семена и дрова.
texts.en:
Larisa has been growing greenhouse produce in the village of Privetnoe for 22 years. Specializing in vegetable farming, she grows early-season vegetables in her greenhouses; also, on her land plot, she grows eggplant/aubergines, cabbage, cauliflower, peppers, broccoli, tomatoes, beets, oninons, etc. under protective film.

Larisa needs 30,000 UAH in order to prepare her greenhouses for the next season, specifically to buy fertilizers, chemicals, plastic film, landscape fabric, seeds and firewood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, plastic covering for greenhouses, firewood and seeds.

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn is managing her eatery business in Ozamiz City. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well at supporting the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business
